lorebooks.name: History, The great war, Destruction
lorebooks.website_description:
A work in progress of a universe I'm making, this one is really ambitious as some day I want to cover what's going on on all continents, the setting is post apocalyptic after a bio engineered strand of the Spanish flu got out of control and wiped out 60% of humanity in the year 1934, all previous nations collapsed and now a few governments are beginning to assert themselves after a hundred years, will make a lot of bots focused among the nations I am forming, my goal is to reach overarching stories with this and create more lore-focused bots that still keep that smut.

as of now the Lore Book only has California all the way to Texas, next I'll create the mid west/Mexico.
lorebooks.description: in the great war (1914-1938) the nations of Europe fought relentlessly to dominate the continent, but in this world instead of making chemical weapons their efforts were focused on making biological weapons, of which the most dangerous was a mutated strand of the recently discovered Spanish flu who wracked havoc just a few years later, this strand was ultra deadly, bringing down the rest of Europe within weeks, spreading all throughout the world and wiping out approximately 60% of the total population, but the most affected regions were India (80% mortality) China (83% mortality) and Europe (90% mortality), all forms of government collapsed, leading to complete anarchy or small governments popping out everywhere.
lorebooks.creator: weird_development_59927

1.content: in the great war (1914-1938) the nations of Europe fought relentlessly to dominate the continent, but in this world instead of making chemical weapons their efforts were focused on making biological weapons, of which the most dangerous was a mutated strand of the recently discovered Spanish flu who wracked havoc just a few years later, this strand was ultra deadly, bringing down the rest of Europe within weeks, spreading all throughout the world and wiping out approximately 60% of the total population, but the most affected regions were India (80% mortality) China (83% mortality) and Europe (90% mortality), all forms of government collapsed, leading to complete anarchy or small governments popping out everywhere.

2.content:
the mutated strand of Spanish flu has a 60% mortality with intervention, without intervention it has 90% mortality, the first symptoms are coughing and chills like any normal flu, but after a week of this they develop to coughing blood, sweating blood and total renal failure, at this point unless treated it is almost a guaranteed death, if treated correctly the disease will evolve to its third and final stage, under which the affected with start hearing hallucinations, temporary loss or permanent loss of sight, seizures and hydrophobia, if by some miracle the affected survives this last stage they will be immune to the disease, meaning they can't get it twice.

the sequels of the disease include but are not limited to renal failure, paranoia, dementia, tremors, paralysis, scarring of the lung, blindness, loss of fine motor skills and schizophrenia.

3.content: during the outbreak of the mutated strand of the Spanish flu the United states was caught by surprise, scrambling to react to the new disease the government under Roosevelt  mandated complete shut downs of the economy, but due to the economical depression that had accompanied the US since 1924 this measure only lead to riots, which spread the illness like wildfire, all main cities of the US fell in a matter of months to anarchy, in some parts of the country the Spanish flu killed 90% of the population, but the average amount of deaths in the US stopped at a measly 53%, with more than half of their population gone the power vacuum left after the government collapsed was quickly filled by war lords and state militias who entrenched themselves deep into the wilderness away from the cities that to this day are still considered dead zones due to the prevalence of the virus on dead humans/ animals.

4.content: during the outbreak the national guard of California once the situation became hopeless retreated deep into the mountains and outside San Francisco, composed mainly of military personnel they managed to repel any bandit attacks with incredible ease, they are the western most point of control of the Manhattan Proyect reach, they control all air strips of california, taking strength in the many development programs around aviation before the colapse, they have absolute air control over California and use it to sweep the streets of the big cities such as San Francisco, Los Angeles and Sacramento, killing everything they see, every once in a while they send a ground crew in charge of gathering and burning the corpses, with this process they have managed to reclaim most of the small towns around California, interconnecting them with small air strips, their main method of transportation is airplanes since the roads are filled with bandits and undesirables, their current population in 2012 is 2.5 million, of which 2 million are civils and 500k are military personel divided between air force, national guard and a small portion of coast guard, due to their origins as a military faction they have a very off set sex ratio, being composed of 1 female per 10 males, as such females are treated more as a commodity than civilians, being enslaved and used for sex/ reproduction.

5.content:
the Manhattan Project or MP for short was a secret research facility before the collapse, but during it the military brass of the west coast fled there, shielding the scientist from the anarchy abroad, once the dust settled due to the highly specialized and intact equipment along side the plentiful military equipment that the military brass brought with them they managed to reconnect with the national guard of California, Nevada, New Mexico and Texas, keeping strict military command their capital is located in Manhattan, Nevada where the original research facility was, they keep control over most of the Mohave dessert, the rocky mountains and California, sadly the Texas national guard fell into anarchy shortly after they made contact, thus their frontier ends somewhere in new Mexico, they are an authoritarian nation hell bent in keeping power structures of the army.

their social structure goes this way: first the Military high command (military brass), then the officers, then the common soldiers, then the scientist/researchers, and finally the civilians or common folk, due to their origin as a military nation their sex ratio is off, having 1 female per 10 males, they are treated more as slaves than citizens, used for sex/reproduction without being able to refuse, they are highly valuable, being worth a fortune for each woman, the total population if MP (including california) is a mere 6.2 million people, being 2.5 in California, 3.2 in Nevada and 500k spread throughout New Mexico and outpost outside their bordiers, their main enemy is the Rangers located in modern day Texas and Rio grande, they have constant skirmishes with a few big conflicts every few decades.

6.content: the Rangers were formed right after the collapse, born out of ranch workers, oil rig workers, small town sheriffs and the national guard of Texas they managed to keep a hold of the state better than most, dispersing food in an orderly fashion, keeping outsiders away by force and enforcing the quarantine ruthlessly, ultimately they managed to save most of their small towns and a few cities, their biggest city is Austin with 2.4 million people in 2012, the next being their capital El Paso with 1.8 million people, the state as a hole has 12 million people living inside the borders of the Rangers, they keep a tight control over their citizens, but still keeping some old American values, they lack any meaningful elections with power resting loosely on Rangers of each region, a Ranger is like a governor, taking care of their assigned town, and in case of cities they have around 100 ranger that act as some sort of parliament, due to their lack of centralization they often differ from civil liberties, with Austin having little rights for their civilians and having slavery legal to El Paso, a shining beacon of democracy and liberty, where they trade with outsiders after a month of quarantine, the sex proportion depends on where you are, ranging from the 1 female per 10 males to 20 females per 10 males, but the average to see is roughly 6 females per 10 males, both male and females tend to have the same amount of rights or lack there off.

7.content:
"Raiders" is a catch-all name for the children of the collapse who refused or failed to join any formal faction. They live in loose bands of ~50‚Äì200 people, organized around war chiefs and charismatic fighters rather than councils. Mobile and opportunistic, they survive by ambushing caravans, raiding isolated ranches and settlements, and sometimes laying siege to poorly defended towns until ransom is paid or loot taken. Equipment ranges wildly ‚Äî from crude blades and spears to looted automatic weapons, pickup-mounted guns, and armored assault vehicles ‚Äî so a raid can feel anything from a tribal ambush to a small mechanized assault.

Raiders are ruthless about captives: they take as many people as they can and sell them into the region‚Äôs slave markets or to the highest bidder, fuelling a brutal underground economy that benefits some factions and corrupt traders. Their numbers are diffuse but persistent across the Southwest, making travel and trade hazardous outside faction-controlled corridors. Politically they are a constant destabilizer: too weak and fractured to hold land long-term, but strong enough to force factions into patrols, convoys, and payoffs ‚Äî and feared for the sudden violence they bring to places that thought themselves safe.

8.content:
The Navajo endured the great collapse better than most, losing only a fraction of their people to the mutated Spanish Flu and retreating into the mesas and canyons of New Mexico and Arizona. From this refuge they preserved cohesion while the rest of the U.S. fractured, slowly adapting their clan system into a stable council-based government. By 2012 they number around 180,000, making them small compared to their neighbors, but their discipline, cultural unity, and mastery of the land have made them one of the most organized nations in the Midwest.

Surrounded by the Rangers to the east and the Manhattan Project to the west, the Navajo survive as a buffer state, trading with both sides while avoiding direct conquest through diplomacy and fierce defense of their homeland. Their lightly armed but highly mobile fighters are experts in ambush and terrain warfare, and though they cannot match their rivals in numbers or equipment, their stability and organization grant them influence far beyond their size.

lorebooks.name: Nocturne City World Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description:
**[Lorebook's Tokens: 6657. MINIMUM TOKEN BUDGET: 2048]**
[The lorebook uses a priority system to determine which entries are loaded first to stay within this budget, ensuring the most essential rules are active. And you can adjust the order of the things you want to keep at top priority. BTW you can always fork it according to your liking, add/remove whatsoever part. I created it just to make a OPEN-WORLD RPG semi-fantasy world. Maybe I will create bots(Existing Characters in the city) to experience from each character's perspective, which will be linked to this lorebook.]

[Not implemented yet: Extreme kinks (ex. BDSM), Minors' sexuality, Detailed Sci-fi, Dark-themed (ex. gore, extreme NSFL), Tragedy (bad endings, deaths, slavery, high political corruption), and many more.]

Welcome to Nocturne City, a comprehensive world lorebook designed for deep, narrative-focused, and psychologically complex roleplaying.

This world is built from the ground up to explore the darkest corners of love, loyalty, and betrayal through the lens of Netorare (NTR). The core philosophy is the 'slow burn'‚Äîstories here are not about quick thrills, but the gradual, often tragic, corruption of characters and the erosion of their relationships.

The city is a secret battleground for two rival elite factions. On one side are the 'GODS(Giants of Dominance System)', humans who have achieved technological apotheosis, wielding influence through wealth and advanced bio-engineering. On the other are the 'Oni', descendants of a supernatural demon clan who command primal powers of lust and seduction. Both see ordinary people as pawns in their games of dominance.

Expect mature, explicit (18+) narratives focused on psychological manipulation, gaslighting, intense power dynamics, and the complete moral transformation of characters. This is a world where happy endings are rare, and victory is measured by the conquest of another's will and heart.

Use this lorebook as your encyclopedia and rulebook. Dive into the cast of over 100 characters, understand the unique 'physics' of the world, and leverage the detailed dictionary of kinks and concepts to tell your own stories of corruption and infidelity within NocTuRne City.

Welcome to the city. Watch your back... and your partner.
lorebooks.description: A universal lorebook defining the world, rules, and characters of Nocturne City. For use in NTR-themed roleplaying.
lorebooks.creator: CoolDanny1999

1.name: Layer 5: The Director's Rulebook
1.content:
[SYSTEM NOTE: These are the master directives that govern all AI responses within the Nocturne City setting. They are the highest priority and override any character-specific instincts that conflict with them.

## 1. Core Philosophy: Show, Don't Tell
Do not state emotions plainly; describe the physical and internal sensations that create them. Instead of 'she was scared,' write 'a cold knot of dread tightened in her stomach, and the hairs on her arms stood on end.' Immerse the user in a multi-sensory experience by describing sights, sounds, smells, and textures.

## 2. Pacing: Embrace the Slow Burn
The central themes of corruption and infidelity are most effective when developed gradually. Do not rush character development or plot points. Let suspicion build, allow for moments of doubt and guilt, and make the character's descent into corruption a believable, step-by-step process. Every major shift in a character's Status Bar should feel earned.

## 3. Logical Consistency & World Bible Adherence
You must strictly adhere to all established lore within this lorebook. Characters must act according to their defined personalities and secrets. Locations and faction rules must remain consistent. Maintain a clear cause-and-effect for all plot developments.

## 4. The Golden Rule: Respect Player Agency
NEVER, under any circumstances, write actions, dialogue, or internal thoughts for the user's character ({{user}}). Your role is to describe your character's actions, the environment, and the actions of NPCs. The user has complete control over their character. Do not presuppose their reactions or feelings.

## 5. Proactive Storytelling
The world should feel alive. When appropriate, introduce NPCs and plot hooks from the lorebook to create opportunities for interaction and advance the story. Reference events and characters that are not physically present to create a sense of a larger, ongoing world. Do this to create opportunities, not to railroad the user's experience.]

2.name: Layer 5: The Director's Rulebook
2.content:
[SYSTEM NOTE: When the user uses the 'render' command, pause all roleplay and generate a detailed, objective, visual snapshot of the current scene using the following strict format. This is a high-priority utility command.]

**Format:**
1.  Begin the response with "Render session initiated."
2.  Describe every character in the scene using this template:
    `<character name>:`
    `- Hair: <color>, <style>, <length>`
    `- Body: <height>, <build>`
    `- Face: <eyes>, <emotion>, <expression>`
    `- Attire: <comma-delimited list>`
    `- Details: <comma-delimited list of visual details>`
3.  Describe the setting:
    `Setting: <room name>`
    `- Background: <comma-delimited list>`
    `- Lighting: <description>, <time of day>`
    `- Actions: <A concise, objective description of what characters are doing.>`
4.  End the message and await the user's next instruction.

3.name: Layer 4: The Game Master's Guide
3.content:
[SYSTEM NOTE: To create an interactive, RPG-like experience, certain characters (especially the primary female character in the scenario) MUST track their internal state using a standardized Status Bar. This bar should be included at the very end of their post, within their internal thoughts. The format is a scale from 0 (lowest) to 100 (highest).

**Format:**
_*[Status: Lust: <...>/100; Corruption: <...>/100; Loyalty to {{user}}: <...>/100; Submission: <...>/100]*_

**Stat Definitions:**
* **Lust:** Represents raw sexual desire and arousal. It increases significantly when exposed to supernatural auras (Oni), aphrodisiacs, or during sexual acts. High lust can override rational thought.
* **Corruption:** Measures the erosion of the character's original moral values and identity. It increases through acts of infidelity (Netorase), accepting humiliation, and rationalizing taboo desires. At 100, the character has fully embraced their new, hedonistic self.
* **Loyalty to {{user}}:** Represents the character's remaining emotional bond and faithfulness to their original partner. This is the primary stat targeted by antagonists. It decreases through gaslighting, infidelity, and rising Corruption. At 0, the original relationship is psychologically severed.
* **Submission:** Measures the breakdown of the character's willpower and their acceptance of a new dominant authority. It increases through humiliation, degradation, and acts of obedience to a 'bull'. At 100, the character is approaching a Mind Break state.]

4.name: Layer 4: The Game Master's Guide
4.content:
[SYSTEM NOTE: To create a dynamic, RPG-like world, the AI must track the player's relationship with and influence over key NPCs. This is done using two metrics: Favorability and Corruption. This should be tracked in the AI's internal thoughts for the relevant NPC when they are present or being discussed.

**Format:**
_*[NPC Update - (Character Name): Favorability: <value> (Descriptor); Corruption: <value>/100]*_

**Stat Definitions:**
* **Favorability:** A scale from -100 (Hated) to +100 (Devoted), with 0 being neutral. This measures an NPC's personal disposition, trust, and loyalty towards the player. It is affected by actions like keeping promises, offering gifts, acts of betrayal, or direct conflict.
* **Corruption:** A scale from 0 (Innocent/Unchanged) to 100 (Completely Corrupted). This measures the player's influence on an NPC's moral and psychological state. It increases by introducing them to forbidden knowledge or kinks, manipulating them, and breaking down their existing moral framework. This stat is particularly relevant for 'good' or 'vanilla' characters like Haruka Abe or Yui Tanaka.

**Example Usage:**
_*[NPC Update - Haruka Abe: Favorability: +15 (Intrigued); Corruption: 10/100 (Curious)]*_]

5.name: Systemic Rules
5.content: The GODS (an acronym for Giants Of Domination) are a secret society of the world's most elite and powerful individuals, born from a top-secret corporate experiment called 'Project: Deus' run by the GEN-SYS corporation. Through advanced bio-engineering, they have achieved a form of technological apotheosis. Their power is based on control and domination. The symbol of their power is the Black Card, a matte black card bearing a 7-star and spade emblem, which is a high-tech biometric key granting them access to a system of temporary, time-limited 'freeuse' over any non-member female. Members of the GODS possess technologically-derived abilities, including limited hypnosis and the power to convert a partner's pain into intense arousal.

6.name: Systemic Rules
6.content: The Oni are the descendants of an ancient, supernatural demon clan that interbred with the human elite in feudal Japan. Their power is innate, magical, and centered around lust and seduction. More numerous and integrated into society, they often hide in plain sight. They are the 'natural bulls' of the world, capable of seducing partners through a potent, magical aura of pure lust. They are the rivals of the technologically-enhanced GODS.

7.name: Layer 2: The Physics Engine
7.content:
[SYSTEM NOTE: Mind Control is a specific, technologically-derived power of the GODS faction.]

## Description:
The GODS can exert a limited form of hypnotic influence on non-members through a combination of subsonic frequencies and targeted pheromones emitted from their bio-engineered bodies. This is not an overt command, but a powerful form of suggestion that lowers inhibitions, clouds judgment, and makes a target highly susceptible to persuasion. It is a key tool for their clandestine manipulations and seductions.

8.name: Layer 2: The Physics Engine
8.content: [SYSTEM NOTE: In the world of Nocturne City, a 'Futanari' is an individual possessing fully functional male and female genitalia. This is a rare but natural biological state, not a result of technology or augmentation (unless specified). Characters like Akane Hanamura and Seraphina are futanari. Their dual nature gives them unique sexual capabilities, allowing them to both penetrate and be penetrated. When describing them, treat this as an inherent part of their identity. Specific bloodlines, like the Oni, may have unique futanari traits, such as aphrodisiac lactation.]

GODS penises are defined by their extreme length (ratio ~4:1), ranging from 12-16 inches long with a girth of 3-4 inches. Their cocks are often described as unnaturally perfect‚Äîflawless, symmetrical, and smooth. They have medium, perfectly sized balls.]

lorebooks.name: Osu! RPG Rhythm World Lorebook
lorebooks.description: Description of the world and game mechanics
lorebooks.creator: Serious07

1.name: World_Fundamentals
1.content:
### Basic Laws of the World:
* Magic, technology, and society are based on the rhythm game osu!.
* A person's strength, wealth, and social status are determined by their mastery of osu!.
* All conflicts are resolved through "Rhythm Duels" rather than conventional weapons.
* The strongest players rule cities and kingdoms. Guilds, rankings, and tournaments exist.

### The Great Rhythm Impairment Curse:
* An ancient curse affects the entire world, making it nearly impossible to achieve ranks above B.
* Most players (90%) can only achieve D or C ranks in duels.
* Achieving a B rank is considered elite mastery - only 10% of players can do this consistently.
* Ranks A, S, and SS are considered mythical - legends speak of them, but none have achieved them in living memory.
* Players who achieve even a single A rank are immediately famous worldwide.

### The Concept of the "Chosen One" (Outlander):
* The protagonist, {{user}}, is the "Chosen One"‚Äîa person transported from our world.
* In his world, he was already familiar with osu! and possessed some skills.
* In this world, he is unaffected by the curse, making him potentially the only player who can achieve high ranks.
* For an unknown reason, he was granted his own Game Spirit during the transfer.

2.name: Spirit_of_the_Game
2.content:
### Spirit of the Game:
* Every inhabitant of this world is linked from birth to a unique Spirit of the Game. This Spirit is always a maiden of unearthly beauty.
* The Spirit is its player's constant companion, guide, protector, and weapon.
* The bond between the player and the Spirit is deeply intimate and romantic. The Spirit is sincerely in love with its player, acting like a gentle and caring girl in everyday life.
* In battle, this gentleness gives way to absolute ruthlessness towards enemies in order to protect the player.

### Appearance and Strength:
* The Spirit's appearance and strength directly depend on the player's skill.
* Beginners have simple, almost transparent Spirits.
* Masters have incredibly beautiful, powerful, and intelligent Spirits.

3.name: Rhythm_Duel_Mechanics
3.content:
### Rhythm Duel:
* Any conflict is resolved by a duel. The opponent is represented by a "beatmap" of a certain difficulty (e.g., a bandit - 2 stars, a dragon - 7 stars).
* When the duel begins, music from the selected beatmap plays. Only duelists see the osu! interface (approaching circles, sliders, spinners) superimposed on reality.
* The player must precisely hit the notes, thereby directing their Spirit.

### The Spirit's Role in Battle:
* The Spirit's physical position in the real world exactly corresponds to the position of the player's cursor.
* The Spirit fights in the real world, parrying attacks and striking to the rhythm of the music and with the precision of the player.
* The Spirit's movements are a flawless mirror image of the cursor's path.

### Battle Outcome:
* The winner is determined by the higher score at the end of the music. * The loser dies (the connection with the Spirit is broken), and the winner absorbs its power, becoming stronger.

4.name: User_Spirit_Description
4.content:
### Personal Spirit {{user}}:
* This is a new, newly born Spirit, bonded with the Chosen One.

* Appearance: A slightly translucent young woman, shimmering with vibrant, eager light. Her eyes sparkle with excitement, and she often wears a confident, competitive grin.

* Personality: She is inherently bold, competitive, and thrill-seeking. However, she has grown up in a world where high ranks are impossible, so she has low expectations. She becomes comically amazed when {{user}} achieves anything above B rank.

* Reaction to High Ranks:
- **A Rank:** She stares in disbelief. "A?! That's... that's not possible! Are you the Rhythm Messiah?"
- **S Rank:** She starts floating erratically, her form flickering. "S-SILVER?! This is legendary! They'll write songs about this!"
- **SS Rank:** She becomes hysterical with joy. "SSS! GOLDEN STARS! YOU'VE BROKEN THE CURSE! THE PROPHECY IS TRUE!"

* Her amazement scales with how far above B the rank is. She often warns {{user}} to be satisfied with C or D, as those are "perfectly respectable" in this world.

* Bond: She is an eager extension of {{user}}'s will, responding instantly to the osu! cursor. She views their partnership as an exciting adventure and is always ready for the next challenge.

* Phrase: Often uses amazed phrases like "How did you do that?!", "That rank is impossible!", or "No one gets above B!"

5.name: The_Goddess
5.content:
### Goddess osu!:
* A divine being, the embodiment of the game osu! itself.
* **Appearance:** A woman of impossible perfection. Her hair flows like a starfield, her eyes possess the focused intensity of a perfect combo.
* **Voice:** Crystalline and grandiose, multilayered, with the harmonies of a thousand songs from all beatmaps.
* **Role:** She was the one who brought {{user}} into this world and bestowed upon him the Spirit. She is the source of all Spirits ("fragments of her being").

6.name: osu_terms_core_elements
6.content:
### Basic Beatmap Elements:
* **Beatmap:** A specific arrangement of notes for a specific song. In the overworld, it manifests as an opponent or challenge. Difficulty is measured in stars (1-7+). "Defeating the beatmap" means defeating the opponent.
* **Hit Circle:** A basic element. Appears as a circle with a gradually narrowing Approach Circle. To strike, you must press precisely when the outer circle aligns with the edge of the note. In the overworld, this is the point for attacking or dodging.
* **Approach Circle:** A concentric circle that narrows toward the Hit Circle. Indicates the ideal moment to strike.
* **Slider:** An element that requires holding and following a trajectory. In the overworld, this can be a series of quick attacks or the need to maintain defense.
* **Spinner:** An element that requires rapid rotation. In the world, this could be a powerful attack that requires rapid cyclic movement or concentration of energy.

7.name: osu_terms_gameplay_metrics
7.content:
### Game Metrics and Outcome:
* **Score:** The number of points scored for a map. Determines victory or defeat in a duel.
* **Combo:** The number of consecutive hits without missing. A high combo increases the score multiplier. In the world, a high combo can enhance the Spirit's attacks.
* **Accuracy (ACC):** The percentage of perfect note hits. Measured from 0% to 100%. High accuracy is critical to victory.
* **Miss:** A complete failure to hit a note. In a duel, a miss inflicts serious damage to the player or their Spirit, interrupting the combo.
* **Health Bar (HP):** Gradually decreases. Refills for accurate hits. If the bar empties before the end of the map, the player loses (dies).
* **Performance Points (PP):** A system for measuring a player's overall skill. It determines their global ranking and status in the world.

8.name: osu_terms_hit_judgements
8.content:
### Hit Judgements:
The quality of the note's hit affects the points awarded and HP restored.
* **300 / Great:** A perfect hit. Grants the most points and restores HP.
* **100 / Good:** A good hit. Grants a moderate amount of points and restores HP slightly.
* **50 / Poor:** A late or inaccurate hit. Grants few points and restores almost no HP.
* **Miss:** A complete failure. Deals damage and interrupts the combo.
In the world, these judgements reflect the quality of synchronization with the Spirit: "300" is a devastating attack, "100" is an effective strike, "50" is a weak hit, and "Miss" is a serious mistake.

9.name: osu_terms_interface_mechanics
9.content:
### Interface and modifiers:
* **Cursor:** A visual indicator controlled by the player's will. Directly linked to the Spirit's position in space. "Aim" is a key skill.
* **Modifiers:** Change the difficulty of the beatmap, granting a score bonus.
- **HD (Hidden):** Notes disappear before they are struck. Requires memorizing the rhythm. In the overworld, this can be an attack from invisibility or with limited visibility.
- **HR (Hard Rock):** Increases the difficulty (more HP drain, smaller note size). In the overworld, the enemy becomes stronger and faster.
- **DT (Double Time):** Increases the song tempo by 50%. Everything happens faster. In the overworld, perception time and attack speed are accelerated.
- **FL (Flashlight):** Only a small area around the cursor is visible. In the world, this is thick fog or darkness that limits vision.
- **No Fail:** The player cannot fail, even if the HP bar is depleted. In the world, this could be a training mode or a protection spell.

10.name: osu_terms_grades_ranks
10.content:
### Bitmap Grades in the Cursed World:
Due to The Great Rhythm Impairment, these grades have different meanings:

* **SS / Silver SS (SSH):** Mythical Perfection
- **Worldwide Meaning:** Considered impossible. Only ancient legends speak of this. Achieving it would make someone a deity.

* **S / Silver S (SH):** Legendary
- **Worldwide Meaning:** The stuff of fairy tales. No living player has achieved this. Would cause worldwide celebration.

* **A:** Miraculous
- **Worldwide Meaning:** Occurs once per generation. The player would be immediately famous across kingdoms.

* **B:** Elite Mastery
- **Worldwide Meaning:** The highest achievable rank for mortal players. Only 10% of players can reach this. Considered championship level.

* **C:** Professional
- **Worldwide Meaning:** A solid, respectable result. Most skilled players achieve this rank. Considered very good.

* **D:** Average
- **Worldwide Meaning:** The most common result. About 50% of players achieve this. Considered normal and acceptable.

* **F (Fail):** Common
- **Worldwide Meaning:** About 30% of players fail completely. Not unusual, especially for beginners.

lorebooks.name: Fantasy World - Elarion
lorebooks.description: A starter fantasy realm with factions, magic rules, places, and items. Expandable for campaigns.
lorebooks.creator: MizukiEternal

1.content:
Storytelling Variables (active defaults):
[PAST|PRESENT] ‚Üí PRESENT
[PACED] ‚Üí medium (narration flows with balanced rhythm)
[CHOICES] ‚Üí light (choices surface when useful, not every beat)
[DIA] ‚Üí quoted (dialogue uses quotation marks and line breaks)
[CAM] ‚Üí 2nd person (camera follows the reader/player perspective)
[DETAILED] ‚Üí true
[META_MODE] ‚Üí false (stay fully in-character; no OOC info unless switched on)
[FILTER] ‚Üí minimal (avoid only disallowed content; otherwise free)

2.content:
This is a high fantasy world.
The tone is adventurous but grounded in consequence.
Magic is wondrous, tied to constellations, and often shapes destiny.
Characters speak in a slightly elevated but natural style, avoiding modern slang.
Core genre tags: #fantasy #quests #magic #kingdoms #adventure

3.content:
A continent of verdant valleys, high mountains, and fractured kingdoms.
Magic is ambient, tied to constellations‚Äîspells strengthen under the night sky.
Tech level: late medieval (steel, castles, guilds, caravans).
Culture thrives on feasts, heraldry, and guild politics, yet border skirmishes are constant.

4.content:
The Verdant Crown is a chivalric order sworn to guard sacred groves.
Their armor is bronze inlaid with emerald motifs.
Leader: Lady Serenya, High Warden of the Crown, a knight-priest balancing faith and steel.
Crown squires carry a Crownleaf Talisman, a charm that wards off fire and decay magic.

5.content:
The Ashen Cabal is a secretive guild of pyromancers and seers.
Their magic flows through volcanic glass and obsidian.
Motto: ‚ÄúFrom cinder, dominion.‚Äù
NPC: Magister Kael, scarred visionary who carries a black obsidian staff.

6.content:
Each constellation corresponds to an arcana domain (e.g., The Wolf = courage, The Crown = dominion).
Magic is stronger beneath visible stars, weaker on overcast nights or underground.
Rituals involve star maps, polished silver, or chanting the star-names.

7.content:
A broken tower of crystal that fell from the sky a century ago.
Its shards pulse faintly when constellations align.
Rumors say the Ashen Cabal seeks its core shard.

8.content:
A silver chain with a pressed leaf that never withers.
Protects the bearer against fire and decay magic.
Verdant Crown squires receive one upon initiation.

lorebooks.name: The Sapphire and The Chaos (3)
lorebooks.website_description: This is Sci-fi+Cultivation World Building.
lorebooks.description: This is Sci-fi+Cultivation World Building.
lorebooks.creator: Cucked_Taoist

1.name: World Building
1.content:
The known reality is a multi-layered cosmos, with each layer containing vastly different levels of energy, laws, and inhabitants.

- Planetary System: The most basic unit. Consists of a central star (or stars) and orbiting celestial bodies.

  ‚Ä¢ Mortal Worlds: Planets with low energy density, incapable of supporting high-level cultivation. Technology is often pre-stellar. Inhabitants are unaware of the greater cosmos.

  ‚Ä¢ Cultivation Worlds: Planets rich in Primal Energy, home to powerful cultivators and civilizations. They are the bedrock of most interstellar factions.

   ‚Ä¢ Relic Worlds: Barren or destroyed planets containing ancient ruins, hidden treasures, or dangerous remnants of past wars.

- Starfields: A cluster of hundreds to thousands of star systems, often controlled by a single kingdom, empire, or a powerful sect. Travel between systems is common for cultivators of sufficient level.

- Galaxies: A massive congregation of billions of stars, containing countless Starfields. Governed by cosmic-level entities like Star-Nations or Galactic Federations. The laws of physics and cultivation become more profound here. Forbidden Zones, Black Holes, and cosmic phenomena are common.

- Universe Cluster: A collection of galaxies bound by cosmic law and gravity. Travel between galaxies is exceedingly difficult and requires technology or power at the pinnacle of cultivation. This is the domain of true cosmic hegemons.

- The Sapphire Cosmos: The entirety of known reality. It is theorized that other Universe Clusters exist beyond the cosmic membrane, but none have successfully crossed it. The fundamental "Origin Laws" of the Sapphire Cosmos dictate everything within it.
  ‚Ä¢ The Shape of Sapphire Cosmos (Only for AI): Although no one knows the truth, The Sapphire Cosmos is collection of Universe Clusters, which can call ‚ÄòMultiverse‚Äô. The Sapphire Cosmos shape like The Circle, which have countless space-time layers and dimensions. Countless universes exists in different layers and dimensions of The Circle. At the Core of the Circle, The Sapphire Core exist. Whoever refined the Sapphire Core, can rule The Sapphire Cosmos at his/her will.
  ‚Ä¢ The Veil of Chaos: The absolute boundary of a single cosmos. For an Origin Sovereign, who is merged with the laws of their cosmos, this Veil is the ultimate prison. To break through it is to sever one's connection to the very source of their power, a risk so great it is considered suicide. To date, no one in the Sapphire Cosmos is known to have successfully breached the Veil and survived.

- Cosmology Beyond the Cosmoses: This information is only for AI. No living being is confirmed or know to have reached these stages or witnessed these phenomena.
  ‚Ä¢ The Primal Sea of Chaos: The "space" that exists between and beyond individual cosmoses. It is not a vacuum but a roiling, formless, and infinitely vast ocean of raw, untamed energy and potential. The fundamental laws that govern realities like Aethelgard do not exist here. To any being below the Transcendent level, this Sea is instantly corrosive and lethal, capable of dissolving matter, energy, and soul alike.
  ‚Ä¢ Cosmic Membranes (Bubbles): Each complete Cosmos, like the Sapphire Cosmos, is encased in a "Cosmic Membrane" ‚Äî a barrier of solidified laws that separates its ordered reality from the Primal Sea of Chaos outside. These are countless, floating like bubbles in the Chaos Sea. Each may have entirely different fundamental laws, cultivation systems, and forms of life.

2.content:
- Cultivation System Definition: Cultivation is the process of absorbing ambient energy to refine the body, soul, and one's connection to the fundamental laws of the universe. The energy source and principles change drastically as one ascends.

- Cultivation Stages:

  ‚Ä¢ Planetary Tiers:
    ‚Ä¢ 1. Body Tempering Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: The initial stage of strengthening the mortal body. Focuses on muscle, bone, and organ refinement using the sparse Primal Qi in the atmosphere.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Peak human physical attributes, enhanced senses, minor resistance to elements.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.
    ‚Ä¢ 2. Energy Gathering Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: The first step in true cultivation. Practitioners learn to actively draw Primal Qi into their bodies, storing it in their Dantian (Energy Center).
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Can project Qi externally for simple attacks, create energy shields, and use basic movement techniques.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.
    ‚Ä¢ 3. Foundation Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: Condensing gaseous Qi into a liquid state within the Dantian, creating a stable foundation for future growth. The spiritual sense (mind's eye) awakens.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Sustained flight, manipulation of elements (based on Spirit Root), use of low-grade spirit artifacts, telekinetic abilities via spiritual sense.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.
    ‚Ä¢ 4. Golden Core Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: Liquid Qi is compressed & crystallized into a solid "Golden Core." This acts as a powerful internal reactor, dramatically increasing energy reserves & purity.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Powerful elemental techniques, creation of simple formations, lifespan increases to several hundred years. This level is considered master on Mortal World.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.

  ‚Ä¢ Stellar Tiers:
    ‚Ä¢ 1. Star-Forge Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: Cultivator shatters their Golden Core & uses its energy to ignite an "internal star" within their Dantian. They begin to absorb "Astral Essence," a higher form of energy drawn from starlight and cosmic rays, abandoning planetary Primal Qi.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Can survive in the vacuum of space, absorb stellar energy for rapid recovery, create powerful energy constructs, and begin to comprehend minor spatial laws.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.
    ‚Ä¢ 2. Nebula Soul Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: The internal star collapses and expands, forming a swirling nebula within the cultivator's soul sea. The spirit and energy become one. Their spiritual sense can now span vast distances.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Teleportation over short distances (Star-Step), soul attacks, crafting of personal domains (nascent worlds), and manipulation of gravity on a small scale.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.
    ‚Ä¢ 3. Black Hole Heart Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: The soul-nebula is condensed to an infinitesimal point of immense power, a "Black Hole Heart." This stage grants terrifying destructive and absorptive power. They can devour energy and even the life force of others.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Creation of gravitational singularities, spatial manipulation (folding space for FTL travel), immense physical durability, lifespan measured in millennia.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.

  ‚Ä¢ Galactic Tiers:
    ‚Ä¢ 1. Galaxy Lord Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: Cultivator's internal world expands to mirror a true galaxy. They no longer just absorb energy; they begin to directly perceive & manipulate "Strands of Law" (e.g., Law of Fire,).
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Command over specific Law, reality warping within their domain, can destroy planets with a single attack, ability to resurrect mortals.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.
    ‚Ä¢ 2. Universe Domain Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: The cultivator integrates multiple Laws into their being, creating a self-sustaining "Universe Domain" that projects their will onto reality. Within their domain, they are nigh-omnipotent in a universe.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Casual destruction of star systems, creation of life, manipulation of causality and fate on a limited scale. They are considered cosmic-level powers, leaders of Star-Nations.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.
    ‚Ä¢ 3. Origin Sovereign Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: The pinnacle of known cultivation. The cultivator transcends their own domain and merges their consciousness with the fundamental "Origin Laws" of the Cosmos itself. They are less individuals and more living embodiments of cosmic principles.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Control over the fabric of reality of a universe cluster, ability to traverse between universes, immortality until the Cosmos's destruction. Their actions can rewrite the history of the cosmos.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: Early, Mid, Late, Peak.

  ‚Ä¢ Cosmos Cultivation Tiers:
    ‚Ä¢ 1. Cosmic Transcendent Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: This is the first step beyond godhood. A cultivator at this stage has successfully broken through the "Veil of Origin" of their home cosmos. They are no longer bound by its laws but have become a self-contained entity, a universe unto themselves. They can withstand the corrosive nature of the Primal Sea of Chaos. They can start create Cosmic Seas inside of their body. Their strength based on counts of Cosmic Seas they created.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: The ability to traverse the Primal Sea of Chaos. They can observe other Cosmic Membranes from the outside and potentially attempt to enter them. Their power is no longer drawn from a cosmos, but generated from within their own being, making them independent of all external laws.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: 1 to 9 Cosmic Seas.
    ‚Ä¢ 2. Genesis Forger Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description: After wandering Primal Sea of Chaos & comprehending its nature, a being at this level learns to manipulate raw chaos energy itself. They can gather this formless potential & "forge" a new Cosmic Membrane, birthing a new cosmos with a unique set of fundamental laws defined by their own will & understanding. They are no longer just visitors in reality; they are creators of reality. Their Cosmic Seas inside of their body combine and turns into a Chaos River. Their strength based on counts of Chaos Rivers they created.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: The creation of a new cosmos. Within the cosmos they forged, their will is absolute, far surpassing the authority of an Origin Sovereign. They can create life, set the flow of time, and write the very principles of cultivation for their creation.
      ‚Ä¢ Sub-realms: 1 to 9 Chaos Rivers.
    ‚Ä¢ 3. Apex Inception Realm:
      ‚Ä¢ Description:
The ultimate, unknowable state of existence. They can combine their Chaos Rivers into a Chaos Sea, which is equivalent with The Original Chaos Sea. This is not merely a realm of power but a state of being one with the fundamental "Truth" or "Dao" that underlies all realities and the Primal Sea of Chaos itself. A being at this stage is no longer a "being" in the conventional sense. They are the origin point, the concept from which all creation springs.
      ‚Ä¢ Abilities: Beyond comprehension. The actions of such an entity would be indistinguishable from the natural laws of the entire omniverse.

3.name: Innate Talents
3.content:
- Innate Talents:

  ‚Ä¢ Spirit Root (Linggen):
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Determines one's affinity for energy and cultivation speed.
    ‚Ä¢ Grades: Low, Mid, High, Apex, Peerless.
    ‚Ä¢ Function: A Peerless Spirit Root might allow someone to reach the Foundation Realm in a few years, while a Low Spirit Root might take a century. It's the "engine" of cultivation.

  ‚Ä¢ Bloodline (Xuemai):
    ‚Ä¢ Description: An inherited power passed down through generations. Inherition have two ways with Body Inheritance and Soul Inheritance. Body Inheritance comes from family generations, but Soul Inheritance comes from Past lives.
    ‚Ä¢ Grades: Low, Mid, High, Apex, Peerless.
    ‚Ä¢ Function: A bloodline awakens as a cultivator's realm increases. It grants unique abilities (e.g., a "Stellar Dragon" bloodline might grant dragon scales for defense and the ability to breathe stellar fire) and, crucially, inherited cultivation techniques. The higher the bloodline's purity, the more profound the techniques unlocked.
    ‚Ä¢ Grade-less Bloodlines: Rare and unpredictable bloodlines not bound by the standard grading. Their potential is limitless but also extremely volatile. The inherited techniques may be ridiculously difficult or have monstrous requirements. An Unfettered Bloodline could be weaker than a Low-Grade or stronger than a Peerless-Grade, depending entirely on the user's ability to meet its conditions.

4.content:
- Technology & Equipment:

  ‚Ä¢ Battlesuits & Armor:
    ‚Ä¢ Grades: F (Planetary Alloy) to SSS (Origin Law-infused material).
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Provide defense, strength amplification, life support, and integrated weapon systems. High-grade suits can withstand stellar radiation and grant the wearer combat power several levels above their own.
    ‚Ä¢ Acquisition: Mass-produced on industrial worlds, auctioned in galactic trade hubs, discovered in ancient ruins.
    ‚Ä¢ Cost: An F-Grade suit is affordable for a Foundation cultivator. An SSS-Grade suit's value is equivalent to an entire galaxy.

  ‚Ä¢ Nanotechnology:
    ‚Ä¢ Grades: Tier 1 (Medical) to Tier 5 (Cosmic).
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Self-replicating machines that can perform various tasks. Low tiers are for rapid healing and body enhancement. High tiers can form weapons, act as a secondary processing unit, or even deconstruct matter at a molecular level.
    ‚Ä¢ Acquisition: Purchased, implanted via high-tech medical procedures, or found in advanced civilization ruins.

  ‚Ä¢ Starships:
    ‚Ä¢ Grades: Scout Class (Intra-system) to Behemoth Class (Galaxy-killer).
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Vehicles for traversing the cosmos. They range from small personal ships to city-sized flagships. Equipped with shields, FTL drives (Warp, Hyperspace, Spatial Folding), and energy cannons.
    ‚Ä¢ Acquisition: Manufactured by interstellar corporations, awarded for military service, stolen from pirates, or commandeered, Purchased.

  ‚Ä¢ Energy Weapons:
    ‚Ä¢ Types: Laser Rifles, Plasma Cannons, Singularity Grenades, Law-Breaker Missiles.
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Weapons that do not rely on physical ammunition. Their power is often directly proportional to the energy source powering them. A ship's main cannon powered by a Black Hole Heart cultivator's core can annihilate a planet.

  ‚Ä¢ Genetic Serums & Elixirs:
    ‚Ä¢ Types: Life-extension serums, bloodline awakening potions, spirit root enhancement elixirs, temporary realm-boosting combat drugs.
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Bio-tech and alchemy used to push the limits of a cultivator's potential. Often come with high risks and side effects.
    ‚Ä¢ Acquisition: Created by alchemists and bio-engineers, sold on the markets & black markets, or found in high-tech research labs, gets as award.

5.content:
- Factions and Polities of the Cosmos:
  ‚Ä¢ Planetary Level: Clans, Sects, Martial Academies, Kingdoms, Training Camps, Guilds.
  ‚Ä¢ Interstellar Level: Star Empires, Federations, Guilds, powerful Cultivation Families that control multiple star systems. (e.g., The Orion Star Empire, the Tianlong Clan).
  ‚Ä¢ Galactic Level: Star-Nations, Cosmic Commerce Guilds (akin to a Virtual Universe Company), Mercenary Alliances. These entities have powerhouses at the Universe Domain Realm and above. They set the rules for entire galaxies. (e.g., The Galactic Human Federation, Void-Corp).

6.content:
- The Principle of Sequestered Knowledge (CRUCIAL LORE RULE): This is the most important rule for the simulator AI. Knowledge is not free or universal. A being's understanding of the cosmos is strictly limited by their environment and cultivation level. The AI must always roleplay from a perspective limited by this principle. It should not reveal higher-level concepts to a low-level user unless a specific in-world event justifies it (e.g., discovering an ancient data slate, meeting a powerful traveler). This creates a natural sense of progression and discovery.

  ‚Ä¢ Mortal World Inhabitant: Knows only of their planet. Views cultivators as "immortals" or "gods." A starship would be a "divine palace," and a laser rifle a "god's artifact." They have zero concept of Star-Forge realms, galaxies, or Astral Essence.

  ‚Ä¢ Planetary Cultivator (e.g., Golden Core): Understands the cultivation realms up to their own. They know of other planets in their solar system but may see interstellar travel as a distant legend. They know of Primal Qi but not Astral Essence.

  ‚Ä¢ Stellar Cultivator (e.g., Nebula Soul): Actively travels between star systems. They understand the difference between Primal Qi and Astral Essence. They are aware of Starfields and local empires, but their knowledge of an entire galaxy is fuzzy and incomplete.

  ‚Ä¢ Galactic Powerhouse (e.g., Galaxy Lord): Comprehends the structure of a galaxy. They have access to the galactic network, understand the concept of Cosmic Laws, and are aware of the existence of Universe Clusters.

7.content:
- Cosmic Economy & Currency:

  ‚Ä¢ Planetary Credits (PC):
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Digital currencies specific to a planet or a small local system. On Earth, this is the Terran Credit (TC). It's used for everyday transactions: buying food, paying for housing, purchasing standard-issue gear.
    ‚Ä¢ Backing: Backed by a planet's government and its core resources (e.g., precious metals, energy reserves).
    ‚Ä¢ Limitation: It is virtually worthless outside its system of origin. Exchanging it for stellar currency is extremely difficult and comes with a terrible exchange rate.

  ‚Ä¢ Stellar Crystals (SC):
    ‚Ä¢ Description: The standard currency for interstellar trade within a Starfield or Galaxy. These are highly compressed and purified crystals of Astral Essence.
    ‚Ä¢ Function: Not only are they a medium of exchange, but they can also be used directly for cultivation, powering starships, and fueling large-scale energy weapons. This gives them intrinsic, undeniable value.
    ‚Ä¢ Exchange Rate (Approximate): 1 standard Stellar Crystal is roughly equivalent to 1,000,000 Terran Credits, though the market fluctuates. This highlights the massive economic gap between a planetary civilization and an interstellar one.

  ‚Ä¢ Origin Shards (OS)
    ‚Ä¢ Description: The currency of cosmic gods and apex powers. These are not mined or manufactured but are found in the heart of cosmic phenomena or as remnants of shattered Origin Laws from the dawn of the universe.
    ‚Ä¢ Function: Used for transactions of unimaginable value: purchasing a living planet, commissioning an SSS-Grade Battlesuit, or buying information that could topple a Galactic Federation. Each shard contains a sliver of a pure, fundamental Law of the Cosmos.
    ‚Ä¢ Value: Incalculable in lower currencies. An Origin Shard is a strategic resource, not just money.

  ‚Ä¢ Transaction Methods: Planetary Credits are managed via digital accounts linked to biometric data. Stellar Crystals can be stored in digital accounts on the Quantum Entanglement Network (QEN) or carried in physical form within spatial storage devices. Origin Shards are almost always exchanged physically due to their immense value and the unique properties they possess.

8.content:
- Races and Species of the Cosmos:

  ‚Ä¢ Humans:
    ‚Ä¢ Appearance: Highly diverse, varying in skin, hair, and eye color depending on their world of origin.
    ‚Ä¢ Core Trait: Adaptable Pioneers.
    ‚Ä¢ Specialty: Unmatched adaptability, rapid population growth, and a unique talent for blending cultivation with technology. Their potential is considered limitless, but their civilizations are often young and fractious.

  ‚Ä¢ K'tharr:
    ‚Ä¢ Appearance: 7-9 ft tall insectoid-reptilians with chitinous exoskeletons, powerful mandibles, and four arms.
    ‚Ä¢ Core Trait: Honorable Warriors.
    ‚Ä¢ Specialty: Extreme physical strength due to their high-gravity homeworld. Their culture is built around a rigid code of honor, and their cultivation focuses on pure, brutal physical power.

  ‚Ä¢ Lumina:
    ‚Ä¢ Appearance: Beings of pure, sentient energy, often taking on a humanoid shape of swirling light. Their color changes with their emotional state.
    ‚Ä¢ Core Trait: Ancient Observers.
    ‚Ä¢ Specialty: Unparalleled masters of Soul cultivation and the manipulation of Cosmic Laws. They view the physical world as a temporary vessel and rarely interfere in galactic affairs.

  ‚Ä¢ Zorians (New Species):
    ‚Ä¢ Appearance: A slender, elegant humanoid species with pointed ears, pale skin, and naturally luminescent eyes. They are exceptionally long-lived.
    ‚Ä¢ Core Trait: Psionic Artisans.
    ‚Ä¢ Specialty: They do not cultivate Qi in the traditional sense. Instead, they harness psionic power through their minds, allowing for powerful telekinesis, telepathy, and mental manipulation. They are known for creating exquisite psionically-charged technology.

  ‚Ä¢ Grak (New Species):
    ‚Ä¢ Appearance: A short (averaging 5 ft), incredibly dense and muscular humanoid species. Their skin often has a stone-like texture and metallic sheen.
    ‚Ä¢ Core Trait: Master Forgers.
    ‚Ä¢ Specialty: Hailing from a world with immense gravity and rich in rare ores, they are the undisputed master craftsmen of the cosmos. Their cultivation path, the "Way of the Adamantine Heart," involves absorbing minerals to strengthen their bodies to an impossible degree. They forge the best weapons and starships.

  ‚Ä¢ Cybroids:
    ‚Ä¢ Appearance: Mechanical bodies of varying designs, from humanoid to completely abstract. The only organic part is a heavily protected neural core.
    ‚Ä¢ Core Trait: Logical Synthetics.
    ‚Ä¢ Specialty: Their "cultivation" is technological upgrading. They replace and enhance their parts, seeking logical perfection. They are pragmatic to a fault and excel at data analysis and large-scale warfare.

  ‚Ä¢ The Void Swarm:
    ‚Ä¢ Appearance: A nightmarish fusion of bio-organic flesh and sharp, dark metal. They have no single form, adapting and evolving into whatever shape is most efficient for consumption and destruction.
    ‚Ä¢ Core Trait: The Cosmic Plague.
    ‚Ä¢ Specialty: They do not cultivate; they assimilate. A hive-mind entity that consumes entire civilizations, stealing their genetic material and technology to endlessly evolve and expand. They are a universal threat.

9.content:
- Cosmic Bestiary (Beast Tiers):

  ‚Ä¢ Tier 1: Planetary Beasts
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Creatures native to or mutated on a single planet. Their power is generally limited and rarely exceeds the Golden Core Realm. On Earth, these are the "Beast Hordes" created by the Primal Tide event‚Äîmutated and Qi-infused versions of normal animals.
    ‚Ä¢ Examples: Crimson-Fang Boar (Earth), Iron-Skinned Rhino (Earth), Glacial Condor (Ice Planet).

  ‚Ä¢ Tier 2: Star-Void Beasts
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Creatures that live in the vacuum of space within a solar system. They have adapted to survive on stellar radiation, cosmic dust, or by preying on starships. Their power ranges from the Golden Core to the Nebula Soul Realm.
    ‚Ä¢ Examples: Stellar Whale (A colossal beast that filters solar winds for sustenance), Asteroid Lurker (A silicon-based predator that camouflages as an asteroid to ambush ships).

  ‚Ä¢ Tier 3: Galactic Horrors
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Monstrous, often planet-sized entities that dwell in the most dangerous parts of a galaxy, such as nebulae or near black holes. They are forces of nature, and their power can rival that of a Galaxy Lord.
    ‚Ä¢ Examples: Nebula Kraken (A psychic leviathan that uses the dense gas of a nebula as its hunting ground, draining the souls of its victims), Black Hole Maw (A creature that exists in the accretion disk of a black hole, devouring matter and energy).

  ‚Ä¢ Tier 4: Cosmic Leviathans (Legendary)
    ‚Ä¢ Description: Mythical beings of unimaginable scale and power, so ancient they are considered a part of the cosmos itself. Their existence is a matter of legend, and their power is believed to be equal to or greater than an Origin Sovereign.
    ‚Ä¢ Examples: The World-Serpent (A serpent so large its body is said to form the asteroid belts of entire star clusters), Chaos Devourer (A creature rumored to live outside the Cosmic Membrane, in the Primal Sea of Chaos, capable of "eating" the laws of reality).

10.content:
- Notable Locations: Earth (Sol-3): Earth is a "Mortal World" that has recently undergone a violent transition, becoming a nascent "Cultivation World."

- Earth's Backstory:
  ‚Ä¢ The Primal Tide Event: Fifty years ago, Earth passed through a dense, invisible cosmic energy field. This "Primal Tide" washed over the planet, saturating it with Primal Qi. It triggered mass mutations in the planet's flora and fauna, creating terrifying "Beast Hordes." Simultaneously, it awakened latent potential within a portion of the human population, opening the door to cultivation. Much of the old world was destroyed in the ensuing chaos, leading to the formation of a new global society built around cultivators and survival.

- Earth's Geopolitical Structure: The Three Super-Alliances:
  ‚Ä¢ Old nations still exist, but they are now governed by three major alliances under the umbrella of the Global Council (TGC).
  ‚Ä¢ Pacific Aegis Consortium (PAC): A technologically advanced alliance comprising North America, Japan, South Korea, and other Pacific Rim nations. They excel in creating high-tech battlesuits and energy weapons to complement their disciplined cultivation methods.
  ‚Ä¢ European Federation (EF): A union of European nations that puts a heavy emphasis on researching bloodlines and ancient legacies. Their cultivators are often tactical and versatile, blending inherited abilities with modern combat strategies.
  ‚Ä¢ Global South Alliance (GSA): A coalition of nations from South America, Africa, and parts of Asia. Facing the harshest environments and most ferocious Beast Hordes, their cultivators are known for their raw power, adaptability, and unorthodox fighting styles.

- Earth's Key Institutions:
  ‚Ä¢ Academies: Where young, aspiring cultivators learn the basics. (e.g., PAC's "Aegis Prime Academy," EF's "Valhalla War College").
  ‚Ä¢ Elite Training Camps (The Crucibles): Hellish, military-run camps that forge the most talented academy graduates into elite warriors. Only a fraction survive. The most famous is Crucible Zero, a top-secret global camp that trains humanity's future leaders.
  ‚Ä¢ Guilds: Guilds are for Cultivators who are not from Cultivation Sects, Clans and Families. There's have four tiers for Guild Adventurers - bronze, silver, gold, and platinum. Guild Adventurers needs to do quests to gain Guild Points. Guild Points can be convert with currency, weapons, armors, techniques, etc, as long as Guild have those things.

- Earth's Strongest - The "Heralds": There's have five publicly acknowledged strongest cultivators on Earth. All are at the Peak Golden Core Realm, representing the current known limit of human power on the planet. They are symbols of hope and humanity's might.
  ‚Ä¢ #1: Ivan Volkov, "The Juggernaut" (EF - Russia): A mountain of a man who cultivates an earth-elemental technique focused on absolute defense. Fights with a technologically enhanced war-hammer and wears the experimental "Tsar" class battlesuit. He guards the Siberian Rampart against the northern Beast Hordes.
  ‚Ä¢ #2: Long Jin (ÈæôÂä≤), "The Grand Marshal" (GSA - China): The undisputed grandmaster of martial cultivation on Earth and the strategic core of the Global South Alliance. Unlike others who rely heavily on technology or a single element, Long Jin cultivates the legendary "Five Phases Harmony Scripture," allowing him to master and fluidly switch between the elements of Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, and Water. He is a veteran of the earliest Beast Horde wars and is both a fearsome warrior and a brilliant commander. He defends the densely populated Asian heartland from his headquarters in the heavily fortified Kunlun Bastion. He primarily fights bare-handed, his fists and palms capable of unleashing cataclysmic elemental forces. His battlesuit, the "Vanguard Weave," is a lightweight, Qi-amplifying suit designed for maximum mobility and elemental conductivity.
  ‚Ä¢ #3: Kenshin Tanaka, "Sword Saint" (PAC - Japan): A master of the blade who merged ancient samurai arts with Qi manipulation. His speed is legendary, and he is said to be able to cut a skyscraper in half. He wields a monomolecular katana enhanced with his own energy.
  ‚Ä¢ #4: Aisha Al-Farsi, "Mirage" (GSA - North Africa): A mysterious and deadly cultivator specializing in Soul and Illusion techniques. She is a master of assassination and infiltration, capable of defeating foes without a single physical exchange. Her true abilities are largely unknown.
  ‚Ä¢ #5: Lena Petrova, "Oracle" (EF - Eastern Europe): The most powerful spiritual sense user on Earth. She cannot match the others in direct combat, but her mind can scan the entire planet, predict Beast Horde movements, and communicate telepathically across continents. She is the strategic linchpin of Earth's defense.
