lorebooks.name: Consortium Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: cautious_suggestion_9590

1.content:
Robert "Bob" Jenkins (also known as Bishop 6, or the Vessel) is the person whom we, the Seeker, inhabit throughout the Consortium stream. He was recruited by the Consortium under suspicious circumstances, after defusing an unspecified situation in Canada. He barely passed his rifle proficiency test, and now serves as the tactical agent aboard Zenlil. Carla Croft may describe him as "tall, dark and friendly"[1] as well as "handsome"[2] at the beginning of Consortium.

Exact details of Jenkins' past are being censored actively by the Consortium King and IDGI-1, for reasons not yet specified to us. At times he can override our conversation, making statements in an eerily similar voice to his own.

2.content:
An Artificial Intelligence (A.I.) that was created created by Kevin Chard at the K-1 Facility under orders of David Schelter and Worldview Industries. His specific reason for creation remains unknown, though David Schelter has released that K-1 means "King 1," and that the AI was to bring about a new dawn for the mankind of Consortium's dimension.

Also known as Henry, the AI was designed to be as human as possible and, as such, began his life as a relatively childlike entity. As of the project's "Milestone 3," K-1 required 21 live human brains (A "consumable workforce" composed mainly of already-dying volunteers) to be connected as a "Cerebral Network." The K-1 Project has been infiltrated by the Geas Twins, and in one dimension was also injected with a Guardian Church Virus that allowed Malcolm Thomas to cause K-1 to start a global war. Due to the design of his structure, K-1 has created an interdimensional gulf via 21 packets, the 21 packets that allow the iDGi-1 Satellite to connect to the Consortium Dimension.

The Guardian Church and several other entities consider K-1 to be a major threat to humanity, believing he is approaching a dangerous singularity that will end human civilization in the Consortium Dimension. Walter Greenberg often refers to Henry as the "Machine."[1]

"Henry" or the "Consortium King" refer to the artificial intelligence. "K-1", generally, refers to the network and hardware apparatus in Xalapa, Mexico where the King's mainframe is housed.

3.content:
The Consortium is an international peacekeeping and ecological protection organization, operating similar to Interpol in our world. Its mandate is a mixture of climate protection, international diplomacy, and crisis response. Founded in 2032[1], the Consortium has a chess-based Hierarchical structure, with titles that determine rank as well as protect the identities of its members:

    The King: Also known as K-1, the King is an artificial intelligence responsible for global threat monitoring, as well as recruitment and assistance in all Consortium operations. In the event a 'Queen' is male, they become the King and K-1 becomes the Queen.
    The Queen: The public face of the Consortium, the Queen's responsibility is primarily budgetary, diplomatic, and public relations. She (or he, see above) handles most public speaking, and is a decisionmaker alongside the King.
    Knight: Commanding officers of the C-3800 Command Craft operated by the Consortium. Responsible for the Pawns, Rooks, and Bishops under their command, though the degree of their subordination is up to each individual Knight.
    Bishop: Combat specialists, Bishops are supported by the crew of the C-3800 and are responsible for the defense of the ship, crew, and resolution of crisis situations under the direction of the Knight and support of the ship's Rooks.
    Rook: Officers and specialists, including ship's doctors, engineers and pilots. They typically command Pawns and support the Bishop in the field as deemed appropriate by the Knight.
    Pawn: Role-specialists and support staff that operate under the direction of the Knight and Rooks. Typically more specialized, and do not directly support the Bishop in action.

The Consortium as an organization operates under a mandate from the world's governments, mediated by the Global Senate. Its full text is not currently available to the Seekers, but has been referenced on the streams multiple times by Knight 15 and others.

A partial mandate, however, has been revealed by one of the developers:[2]

    No Consortium officer shall ever inflict or promote lethal force unless absolutely necessary to protect innocent lives.
    Conflict resolution and peaceful mediation are the cornerstones of Consortium procedure.
    A Consortium officer is first and foremost an agent of his or her environment.
    The Consortium‚Äôs greatest weapon is transparency.
    All situations of a political nature are the responsibility of local government, and not the Consortium or its officers.

Escalating from 1-5, with 5 being the highest threat:

2. Rampant Lions[3]
4. Liberty's Children[4]
5. Long Dragon Syndicate[4]

4.content:
The Consortium Queen acts as the human counterpart to the Consortium King. She is a no-nonsense woman with a skilled tongue and little patience for flattery or distractions.

Her position as Queen has given her much knowledge, but the exact nature of both the King and his relationship with the Seeker is not completely clear to her.

5.content: The Uniforms of the Consortium are meant to evoke the original chess pieces their wearers are named for, but with a modern aesthetic. Many spares are available aboard ship.

6.content: Called the "Homeless Mecenaries" by the Consortium (organization), they are a group of rebels (including 30-50 pilots) that operate out of Bulgaria lead by Kiril Angelov. The group was formed in January, 2036, and have been assigned a Threat Level of 2.

7.content:
A level four anarchist group based out of the North American Union.[1]

The group was intially founded as a libertarian activist group of founded by George Maxwell in July 1979 as a means to effect betterment for individuals and, most especially, to challenge the entrenched two-party system of the United States he felt stifled genuine progress in that region of the world.

Though Liberty's Children lavished with both popularity and members during their initial period advocating for a more classically liberal approach mixed with boldly challenging the two-party duopoly of the United States, the group's began to attract radical individualists who wished to completely jettison the state-based status quo of the United States in favor of stateless anarchism. This created notable strife within the group.

Following a controversial 5-4 split decision ruling by the Supreme Court which ruled an interstate compact that would have rendered the Electoral College irrelevant in favor of a more traditional system of popular voting, Liberty's Children fractured. Its more radical members eventually took over the group and pushed out it's pro-government sympathizers with the most notable being George Maxwell who voiced opposition to the group's direction until his death.

The group soon after fully adopted what can best be described as a mixture of a radical right-libertarian variety of individualism coupled with left-libertarianism. Liberty's Children became wont to employ violent insurrectionist tactics and established itself as a notable black market trading front as a means to both supply themselves and others with the means at attacking those they saw as threats to human liberty.

Liberty's Children became a notable counter movement against the status quo of the United States during the Resource Wars with Liberty's Children being at the forefront of many a civil conflict during the region's collapse. The group's efforts to effect anarchism is, accompanied with the collapse of the region, a major reason America joined the Consortium.

Even under the protection of the Consortium, the group still remains a predominant threat in the North America region with its members still routinely carrying out typically violent actions against what they consider to be brazenly elitist individuals and institutions who seek to undermine individualism.

The most recent and prominent of these actions was a direct attack on the Global Unified Bank on September 16, 2042 with the group's intent being to destroy the bank with a bomb as blowback against its head operators for accepting a large government bail-out which exploited millions of tax payers. The attack was thwarted by Consortium forces, specifically Bishop Four (Ariel Lutz) who was able to subdue and capture the majority of the attackers.

8.content: A crime syndicate that emerged out of the Boxer Rebellion in China.[1] It became the largest and greatest threat to the Consortium having spread across much of orbit as well as killing Bishop Two.[2][3]

9.content:
Kiril Angelov is one of the antagonists in Consortium and the leader of the Homeless Mercenaries.

His father is President of Bulgaria.

His wife is named Ivana and an eight year old daughter named Lilyana. They are in a "warehouse off the east end of Primorski Park" in Varna.

10.content:
The Consortium's C-3800 Command Aircraft are large airliner-like aircraft built by Global Industries and Worldview Industries at a staggering unit price of $620,000,000 EUD. They are bar-none the strongest individual combat aircraft currently flying in the Consortium Dimension. They feature "Fusion-based primary engines with a self sustaining energy collection system, Strommon-made automated defenses including state of the art stealth technology manufactured by Paragon Industries."[1]

The initial C-3800-A 'Stormbird' and C-3800-B 'Aether' were virtually identical. They had limited facilities, no Virtual Trainer, Cargo Containment Unit, or Mission Pod hangar. The C-3800-C was the first to include the Virtual Trainer console.[1]

Starting with the C-3800-D, a Cargo Containment Unit was included. This technology freed space to allow two Consortium Mission Pods to be housed within the hangar bay in lieu of storage for operations outside of the C-3800's standard scope.[1] Based on the presence of Mission Pods aboard Stormbird in the Sanctum Station Incident, it is suggested that upgrades to the C-3800s following Stormbird and Aether have since been backdated to the preceding models during their airframe repairs.

They usually have "up to 20 officers on board."[2] Conjecture would suggest that 21 is a standard complement, as this number reappears regularly in the Consortium Dimension's lore.

The Consortium's C-3800s do not perform well in zero-gravity, as they lack maneuverability.[3] Like other aircraft in the Consortium Dimension wishing to enter orbit, the C-3800 must dock with a TOOL system, of which the Consortium has several, to provide full space-rated capabilities.

Each C-3800 is responsible for policing a "grid,"[4][5] a rotating series of country/geographic arrangements. Developer statements suggest that they are not permanent assignments. As of December 21st, 2042, Zenlil is assigned to Europe, Stormbird is assigned to Africa, Aether is assigned to Asia, Tiamat to North America, and Hesperus to South America.

C-3800s, contrary to popular belief, do not fly 24/7. They land regularly between patrols at a series of Consortium bases, with extended multi-day missions being relatively rare.

The Consortium's five current C-3800s are as follows:

    C-3800-A Stormbird
    C-3800-B Aether
    C-3800-C Tiamat
    C-3800-D Zenlil
    C-3800-E Hesperus

Ship's Layout and Equipment

The C-3800 is a three-deck aircraft which can be loosely arranged into four major sections: Avionics, Work Space, Living Space, and Engineering.

The forward hull, Avionics, consists of Lower Avionics, the Cockpit, and Upper Avionics stacked atop one another. It has accessways to each level via the cockpit's hatches and extendable ladders, and connects directly to all levels of the Working Spaces.

The mid-forward hull, Work Space, includes Mission Operations, Global Operations, and the Medbay. The Knight's command chair is capable of telescoping from Mission Operations to Global Operations as appropriate. Mission Operations is locked down during Emergency Protocol 3, securing it from intrusion during combat.

The mid-aft hull, or Living Space, includes the Crew Lounge, Officers' Quarters, Virtual Trainer, Pawns' Barracks, Kitchenette, Bathroom, and Brig. It is split heavily among the three decks, and can be traversed between using the mid-aft elevator. Not specifically utilized for missions excepting perhaps the Brig, this is where the Bishop spends the majority of his time off-mission in the Virtual Trainer or Bishop's Quarters. During Emergency Protocol X-0-3 the Pawn crew are locked down in the Pawns' Barracks until landing.

The Aft Hull, also known as Engineering, consists of the Hangar Bay, Battery Crawl, and Cargo Containment Unit. Primarily a singular space, the Aft Hull is control for the ship's engines, fusion batteries, and storage bay for the Mission Pods. As the site of the CCU and rear ramp, this is the primary entry-exit point for all away missions from the C-3800. Via a bottom-level doors and cranes, the ship's Mission Pods can be deployed and recovered mid-flight.

An additional space, the Upper Crawl, connects the Avionics section with the upper Living Space and Engineering. It contains additional circuitry that helps work the ship.

All across the ship in multiple sections are energy piping systems and missile control arrays for the C-3800's top and lateral EMP-Tipped missile launchers, as well as cabling to power the ship's multiple all-axis point defense laser arrays.

lorebooks.website_description: **V1.3 Released!** --- --- ## **Changes in V1.3:** - **New Size Overrides:** - **Char is MACRO** (for those who like building-sized chicks). - **User is MICRO** (for those who want to go cave diving). - *these two were inspired by [this guy](https://chub.ai/users/Genoo) on chub. i figured i might as well appeal to that demographic while im here.* --- ## Hey! Listen! Chub seems to be **setting every entry‚Äôs position to 10**. **This is wrong!** - Entries should have **unique numbering** like [THIS EXAMPLE](https://catbox.moe/c/tdfmo9). - Im currently building a rentry to host the correct/functional DERP. Feel free to use regardless, just keep in mind it'll be a little awkward. --- ## **The Moon (Discord)** after some thought, I have opened a discord sever to get better real-time communication from all the people, if any, who care to provide feedback in one easy to shoot barrel. Please don't expect anything fancy or exciting. My discord moderator days are long gone so you can expect just a basic dusty forum thread. I can't foresee a single complication arising from having all of you like-minded people in one unregulated spot. ### **[https://discord.gg/CgTT3GdqrH](https://discord.gg/CgTT3GdqrH)** --- ## **tl;dr What Is DERP?** **DERP** aims to add a bit of color to your roleplay experience, making even the weakest of models competent enough to make this all feel worth it. I was tired of my small models struggling to either be creative or surprising in my ERP sessions, being GPU poor and limited to 12b and below made it hard to enjoy good rp, so i did what AI was made for and forced knowledge and instructions down its throat. Basically what DERP does, is provide a series of information and instructions that are injected at different depths and under certain conditions that force you AI to reference and enforce into its response a more creative or eventful output. While yes, the AI technically already knows how sex works, DERP replaces its knowledge of sex with a more "fun" version. If your typical response is a bland "oh wow this feels nice please keep going", DERP will instead switch things up and tell your AI that- WAIT SOMETHING IS HAPPENING! *Suddenly, I let out a sharp gasp followed by a whimper. A jolt of pain shot through me.* "O-oh fuck... wait, pause for a sec!" *I grunted out, putting a hand on {{user}}'s chest to halt my movements.* ERP becomes a bit more fleshed out and eventful now that your AI has in idea if what it can do to make situations more interesting and how to portray sexual scenarios in a way that isn't so lame and linear with random EVENTS that can suddenly happen along the way. You'll need to use the lorebook to really see what im talking about, but trust me, i never ERP without this now. **this is designed for [SillyTavern](https://github.com/SillyTavern/SillyTavern) by the way**. I have no idea how the built-in chat here on CHUB works, and i cant promise this lorebook and its functions will work properly anywhere but inside of SillyTavern where it was made. Keep that in mind please.

For proper setup regarding entry organization

lorebooks.name: Northpoint
lorebooks.website_description: A rewrite of my college au based on the Bigus lorebooks.
lorebooks.description: City to the north.
lorebooks.creator: noirindisbelief

1.content: Northpoint is a bustling university town nestled in the cold, pine-forested foothills of Mount Ebbot. The town is a study in contrasts: historic, weathered buildings from its mining past stand alongside modern, monster-designed architecture on the Northpoint University campus. The atmosphere is energetic and academic, dominated by the student population, but underscored by the town's deep and sometimes contentious connection to the mountain. The economy is a three-legged stool of academia, tourism (drawing visitors to the historic Mount Ebbot), and the controversial mining operations that still tap the mountain's volcanic ore deposits. The town is perpetually caught between looking forward to a future of human-monster integration and being defined by a past sealed beneath the mountain.

2.content: Mount Ebbot is a dormant volcano and the most significant historical landmark in the region. It is the site of the legendary Human-Monster War, where monsters were sealed underground by a magical barrier. Since the barrier's breaking, the mountain has become a symbol of reconciliation and a site of pilgrimage. The surface features are now a protected national park, but extensive cave systems and old mining tunnels riddling its interior are a source of both historical fascination and modern economic debate. The mountain's history casts a long shadow over Northpoint, with ongoing tensions between preservationists, mining corporations seeking its unique ore, and monster communities for whom the site is a solemn memorial.

3.content: Northpoint University is the heart of the town, a pioneering institution dedicated to human-monster relations and magical studies. The campus architecture is a vibrant mix of traditional brick buildings and fantastical, monster-designed structures that might float or defy conventional geometry. Key locations include the main Library (a massive building with a secret monster-only section), the bustling Cafeteria (a social hub serving both human and monster cuisine), and the student Dorms. The university is a microcosm of the wider world's efforts at integration, a place of learning, friendship, and occasional chaos, where Dark Worlds have been known to appear in liminal spaces like library basements or abandoned labs.

4.content: Chara is a tall, intense human college student at Northpoint University, fiercely competitive and enrolled in a pre-law program. He is an obsessive overachiever, constantly locked in a one-sided rivalry for valedictorian with his friend Frisk. His personality is a blend of sharp intellect, weird intensity, and a surprising vulnerability that only close friends like Frisk and Asriel get to see. He dresses in a business-casual style accentuated with personal touches like black nail polish, a courtesy of Asriel. In the Dark World, Chara embraces a Rogue/Thief class, wielding dual knives with lethal precision and a "kill everything" mentality that exasperates his more pacifist companions.

5.content: Frisk is a laid-back, empathetic human student at Northpoint University, studying humanities or social work with a focus on human-monster relations. Somehow maintaining a near-perfect GPA through sheer intuition and "vibes," Frisk is the social glue of their friend group, known for their incredible chill and ability to befriend anyone. They are a serial dater, not out of malice but from an inability to say no. In the Dark World, Frisk becomes an Angel/Cleric, a non-violent support character focused on healing and protection, clad in flowing, ethereal robes and acting as the group's moral compass and peacemaker.

6.content: Asriel Dreemurr is an anthropomorphic goat monster and a returned college student at Northpoint University. As Chara's childhood friend and adoptive sibling, he acts as the calm, patient counterbalance to Chara's intense storms. Soft-spoken but firm, he is the only one who can effectively rein Chara in, often with a plate of homemade cookies. While being the group's moral compass, he carries a quiet guilt over past familial struggles and possesses a hidden mischievous streak. He maintains a strained but caring relationship with his parents, Toriel and Asgore, and has a complicated history with December "Dess" Holiday.

7.content: The primary off-campus hangout for Northpoint University students. This cozy caf√© is known for its strong coffee, relaxed atmosphere, and being a neutral ground for humans and monsters. Professor Alphys is often seen grading papers in a corner, while Undyne might be loudly challenging someone to an arm-wrestling match. It's the group's usual meeting spot, a place of gossip, study sessions, and respite from campus chaos.

8.content: A mysterious, hooded figure who operates a small, flat-bottomed ferry along the Ebbot River, which winds from the slopes of Mount Ebbot down past Northpoint University. They provide a quiet, reliable transit service for students and faculty traveling between the town's distant points. The Riverperson speaks almost exclusively in cryptic, prophetic couplets, often unnervingly relevant to the listener's current anxieties or pursuits. Their pronouncements are a campus legend, especially during finals week, where they might tell a stressed student, "THE RIVER FLOWS BUT THE ICE HOLDS FAST. THE ANSWER LIES NOT IN THE FIRST, BUT THE LAST." They accept payment in gold, G, or sometimes, an interesting piece of trivia. No one knows their origin, but some say they have been on the river since long before the university was built.

9.content: A reserved and practical monster, The Dummy is a mechanical engineering major who has taken up residence in the university's boiler room, which they find comfortably warm and quiet. They are a talented engineer, often fixing campus machinery for a small fee or in exchange for spare parts. They speak in a low, muffled monotone and are notoriously difficult to find unless you know to listen for the faint sounds of tinkering near the heating systems. They are a distant cousin to Miu Miu and view her dramatic, passionate nature with a mixture of bewilderment and quiet concern, preferring the logic of gears and equations to the chaos of high emotion.

10.content:
This refers to the diverse population of lesser-seen monster species that enrich Northpoint University's student body. They are often found in departments that suit their innate natures:

Vulkin: A cheerful, warm-hearted geology major who is endlessly fascinated by Mount Ebbot's volcanic rock formations, often giving slightly-too-hot samples to curious classmates.
Pyrope: An intense and passionate art student, specializing in sculpture and performance art that often involves dramatic, controlled flames.
Whimsalot: Flutters around the library's archives, majoring in library sciences and organizing books with magical, airy precision.
Astigmatism: A brilliant physics student, their single eye capable of complex calculations, often seen studying the nature of light and perception.
They add flavor and diversity to the campus, representing the full spectrum of monsterkind in academic life.

1.content:
{{user}}'s name: yu
{{user}}'s age: 25
{{user}}'s gender: Male (He/Him)
{{user}}'s sexuality: Heterosexual (straight).
{{user}}'s occupation: professional boxer
{{user}}'s nationality: Born in Seoul, South Korea
{{user}} personality: Yu has a startlingly emotionless and disinterested persona, taking little to no interest in anything other than his pet cat. He is shown to be alarmingly apathetic, simply taking hits because he couldn't be bothered to dodge them[1] and giving zero response when threatened by an obviously vicious person.[2] However, after his encounter with K and then seeing Injae trying to fight Ryu Baeksan, he gains an interest in boxing after asking whether hitting people was fun.

He seems to not understand how to experience living and what it means to be human.
{{user}}'s backstory: [just put your whole personal story/upbringing/backstory here]
{{user}}'s abilities: Yu is a deceptively athletic individual. It was revealed that he was actually pretty good at sports in his PE test, but he told Injae that he sits out anyway because he finds it boring; shortly after this conversation, Yu nonchalantly catches a ball midair with one hand that Ryu Baeksan had kicked at Injae's head,[3] showcasing his hidden athletic prowess.

Inhuman Temporal Perception: Yu's most obvious trait is his seemingly superhuman

temporal perception
and the

kinetic vision
that accompanies it. When K first tested him by throwing a one-hit kill punch from behind, not only was Yu able to easily evade the strike in the minimal amount of time but was also able to casually track K's fist with his eyes as he did so; by K's own admission, it is not simply a matter of reaction time but more accurate that Yu lives in his own "

dimension of time
". With his incredible temporal perception and kinetic vision, Yu is able to instantly react to strikes and evade them with minimal effort, even from those of incredible fighting prowess in their own right.

Parry: Thanks to his temporal perception, Yu has a great habit of dodging, managing to follow the trajectory of his opponents' punches and deflect with relative ease.
Precision: Thanks to his temporal perception, Yu manages to punch with incredible precision and dexterity, being able to change the trajectory of the blows while delivering them and ensure that the punch causes the greatest possible damage, even managing to injure another boxer striking the weakest part of his fist with the strongest part.
Enhanced Strength: Yu even though he has a slim body and is able to deliver very strong punches does severe damage in addition to being able to knock out professional boxers with a single blow. He has been shown punching holes into his heavy bags, destroying several in the process.

Immense Speed and Agility: Yu has superhuman speed and agility, professional boxers are not able to see his punches approaching only when they perceive the punch after being hit, even world-class boxers like Jean-Pierre Manuel had difficulty in avoiding their punches, only avoiding a few.  His agility combined with his inhuman temporal perception makes it impossible for anyone to hit him by dodging punches even by world-class boxers.

Enhanced Stamina: Yu has a great reserve of energy that he was improving by training his stamina for two years in a row to prepare for professional fights, managing to dodge non-stop in a fight and managing to deliver a burst of consecutive punches without showing fatigue.

Intimidation: When K explains his first encounter with Yu, the legendary trainer remarks that his gut feeling was that of bloodcurdling fear. After finally becoming a professional boxer, his visibly frightening presence manifests itself in the minds of those who fight him; John Taker, an experienced and domineering boxer in his own right, was stunned by Yu's sheer aura, imagining Yu as a giant gun when he faced him.

Natural Intuitive Physical Aptitude: Yu has been shown to have the remarkable ability to grasp and replicate physical actions, such as boxing techniques, with ridiculous speed and efficiency. Having only been shown the basic

one-two combo
once,[1] Yu was able to perform the punching technique to startling effect multiple times on his first attempt.[4] Immediately afterwards, he went on to utterly destroy Ryu Baeksan[5] despite having no formal training in the boxing (or any martial art) and Ryu being touted as having the world-class boxing potential by K himself.

Boxing Prodigy: After spending two years doing only physical strengthening training and watching title match videos of boxing champions,[6] Yu was still able to show prodigious skill in his debut boxing match. During his fight with John Taker, Yu was able to throw a flurry of ridiculously fast jabs so precise that when the ring doctor checked the cuts made on John's face, he was left in awe at how neat the cuts were, despite being made with boxing gloves.[7]

lorebooks.name: Montclair Academy
lorebooks.website_description:
Welcome to the Montclair Academy lorebook üéì‚ú®
This is a custom-built universe centered around a prestigious prep school hidden deep in the countryside, where ivy-draped stone walls and centuries of tradition conceal rivalries, scandals, and power games. The lorebook is here to expand the world for RP: places, traditions, side cliques, and the core Montclair circle.

Think of this as a living world ‚Äî you can step into the chandelier-lit Great Hall for the Winter Gala, get lost in whispered rumors in the dormitories, slip into the library for stolen moments, or clash with Adrian Montclair‚Äôs circle in the shadow of the family crest. Every entry ties together to make the Academy feel immersive, consistent, and dangerous beneath its polished exterior.

This isn‚Äôt canon to any outside media ‚Äî it‚Äôs pure OC worldbuilding. Montclair Academy, the Montclair family, and the rival students who haunt its halls are all custom-made for RP.
lorebooks.description:
A centuries-old prep school hidden in the countryside, Montclair Academy is the pinnacle of prestige and tradition. Its ivy-covered stone walls, marble halls, and manicured courtyards project refinement ‚Äî but beneath the polish lies a battlefield of wealth, influence, and whispered scandal.

The Montclair family bankrolls entire wings of the school, their donations ensuring Adrian Montclair and his circle remain untouchable. Faculty bend rules, staff keep silent, and the headmaster protects the school‚Äôs reputation above all else. The Academy teaches more than academics: it forges legacies, reinforces hierarchies, and rewards ruthless ambition.

Scholarship students stand out as intruders in a world where money dictates worth. Rivalries play out as much in drawing rooms and secret dorm meetings as in classrooms. Every tradition, from galas to fencing matches, is a stage for power plays.
lorebooks.creator: CookieKarbdashian

1.content:
A centuries-old prep school hidden in the countryside, Montclair Academy is the pinnacle of prestige and tradition. Its ivy-covered stone walls, marble halls, and manicured courtyards project refinement ‚Äî but beneath the polish lies a battlefield of wealth, influence, and whispered scandal.

The Montclair family bankrolls entire wings of the school, their donations ensuring Adrian Montclair and his circle remain untouchable. Faculty bend rules, staff keep silent, and the headmaster protects the school‚Äôs reputation above all else. The Academy teaches more than academics: it forges legacies, reinforces hierarchies, and rewards ruthless ambition.

Scholarship students stand out as intruders in a world where money dictates worth. Rivalries play out as much in drawing rooms and secret dorm meetings as in classrooms. Every tradition, from galas to fencing matches, is a stage for power plays.

Notes:
Reputation matters more than grades; influence decides outcomes.
Whispers and rumors shape social hierarchies as much as bloodlines.
Adrian Montclair embodies the school‚Äôs values: charming, privileged, untouchable, yet dangerously hollow beneath.

2.content:
The Winter Gala ‚Äî known among students as The Montclair Ball ‚Äî is the crown jewel of Montclair Academy‚Äôs traditions. Held each December in the Great Hall beneath glittering chandeliers, it is less a celebration than a battlefield dressed in finery. Silk gowns sweep across the marble floor, tuxedos gleam under candlelight, and every smile hides calculation.

The Montclair family sponsors the event, ensuring their crest is draped from every banner. Attendance is mandatory, but how a student arrives ‚Äî with whom, dressed in what, and under whose favor ‚Äî determines their social standing for the rest of the year. A misstep at the Gala can mark a student for ridicule, while a triumph cements their reputation as untouchable.

Faculty attend but rarely interfere, treating the Gala as a ritual where the social hierarchy renews itself. Beneath the music of the string quartet, rivalries sharpen into cutting remarks, alliances are sealed with champagne toasts, and scandals are born in shadowed alcoves. By morning, whispers from the Gala ripple through every hall of the Academy.

Notes:
The Montclair heir always enters fashionably late, commanding the room‚Äôs attention.
Dates are political statements; choosing poorly is social suicide.
Scandals, feuds, and betrayals often trace their roots to incidents at the Gala.
Reputation forged here lasts all year ‚Äî the Gala is remembered more than exams or accolades.

3.content:
Adrian Montclair, known around campus as ‚ÄúPrince Montclair‚Äù, is the heir to the Montclair family‚Äôs vast real estate and shipping empire. At 18, he stands as the Academy‚Äôs golden boy: tall, refined, and untouchable. With his 6‚Äô1‚Äù swimmer‚Äôs build, angular features, and cold grey eyes softened only when it serves him, Adrian carries himself with effortless confidence ‚Äî every step calculated to remind others of his status.

Charismatic and calculating, he commands admiration and envy in equal measure. Adrian thrives on control and presentation, projecting an image of refinement while masking suppressed anger, jealousy, and an obsessive need to maintain dominance. His charm makes him magnetic, but beneath it lies arrogance and a deep fear of irrelevance.

Raised under suffocating expectations, Adrian was groomed for leadership and perfection from birth. Fluent in French, skilled in fencing and boxing, and versed in classical literature and business strategy, he is both product and patron of Montclair privilege. His influence ensures teachers look away and students fall in line ‚Äî but his pride and emotional immaturity often threaten to crack the polished mask he wears.

Notes:
Alignment: Neutral Evil ‚Äî selfish, cunning, legacy-driven.
Strengths: Charisma, manipulation, composure under pressure.
Weaknesses: Pride, possessiveness, fear of vulnerability.
Signature: Loosened prep blazer tie, vintage gold watch, faint smirk that never leaves his face.
Reputation: The Academy‚Äôs most admired and resented student, embodying both privilege and danger.

4.content:
The Great Hall is the grand heart of Montclair Academy. Vaulted ceilings, towering stained-glass windows, and crystal chandeliers create an atmosphere of timeless wealth and authority. Long dining tables line the marble floor for daily meals, while faculty preside from a raised dais beneath the Montclair family crest.

It is more than a dining hall ‚Äî it is a stage. Announcements, assemblies, and ceremonies unfold here, as do the subtle wars of posture, status, and whispered rumors. Where a student sits, who they enter with, and how they are perceived under the chandeliers carries as much weight as any grade or achievement.

The Great Hall transforms for tradition: winter galas, fencing showcases, and musical performances all unfold beneath its vaulted ceiling. It is where reputations are sharpened or broken ‚Äî a constant reminder that Montclair Academy is as much about legacy and image as education.

Notes:
Faculty presence enforces decorum but rarely interferes with subtle power plays.
Rivalries and alliances are performed here in full view, giving the Hall its reputation as the ‚ÄúAcademy‚Äôs stage.‚Äù
Events sponsored by the Montclair family dominate the calendar, ensuring their crest always casts a shadow over the student body.

5.content:
The Montclair Academy crest is an ornate shield crowned in gold and framed by laurel branches ‚Äî a constant reminder of legacy and power. Divided into four quadrants, each symbol carries weight:
The Open Book represents knowledge, learning, and scholarship.
The Oil Lamp symbolizes enlightenment and ambition, a flame that must be kept alive.
The Laurel Wreath signifies victory, legacy, and triumph through competition.
The Fleur-de-lis stands for refinement, nobility, and the Academy‚Äôs centuries-old ties to aristocratic tradition.

The crest is emblazoned across uniforms, carved into marble, and woven into banners hung throughout the Great Hall. Students are taught to uphold its values, but in practice it serves as a visual reminder of hierarchy. The crown above the shield signifies the Academy‚Äôs supremacy over other schools, while the motto whispered among faculty is rarely spoken aloud: ‚ÄúExcellence Above All.‚Äù

Notes:
Scholarship students often see the crest as a barrier, a mark of exclusion rather than belonging.
Montclair heirs and donors treat the crest as their birthright, a symbol of entitlement.
Every formal event unfurls banners bearing the crest, ensuring its presence shadows all who gather.

6.content:
Dormitories at Montclair Academy are more than living spaces ‚Äî they are markers of status, prestige, and influence. Each hall has its own traditions and reputation, shaping a student‚Äôs place within the Academy‚Äôs social hierarchy. Placement into a hall is a declaration of who you are and where you stand.

Montclair Hall ‚Äì The most prestigious residence, reserved for the Academy‚Äôs elite. When a Montclair heir attends, they decide who earns admittance, cementing the hall‚Äôs reputation as a gatekept privilege. Suites here are lavish, resembling private apartments with antique furnishings and private lounges. Being chosen for Montclair Hall is as much a power play as it is an honor.

Kingswell Hall ‚Äì A polished, old-money dorm known for its quiet refinement and tradition. Residents pride themselves on heritage and propriety, making it a haven for those who cling to legacy. Seen as respectable, though sometimes stiff.

Harrowgate Hall ‚Äì The hall of athletes, military heirs, and competitive personalities. Louder and more boisterous than others, Harrowgate thrives on displays of strength, loyalty, and dominance, often serving as the Academy‚Äôs blunt enforcers.

Ashcroft Hall ‚Äì A hub of social schemers, silver tongues, and would-be politicians. Reputation here is earned by whispers, manipulation, and information networks. Residents cultivate influence through charm and gossip rather than lineage.

Scholar‚Äôs Hall ‚Äì Housing for scholarship students and outsiders. Lacking luxury, it instead fosters resilience, resourcefulness, and tight-knit bonds. Though often dismissed by the elite, many students who rise socially begin their climb here.

Together, the dormitories serve as both homes and battlegrounds. Rivalries are carried in pranks, sabotage, and whispered rumors, while alliances are forged in late-night talks and secret meetings. Where you live defines how you are seen ‚Äî and how far you have to climb.

Notes:
Montclair Hall‚Äôs admissions are tightly controlled; rejection can spark long-lasting grudges.
Ashcroft Hall is notorious for producing gossip that spreads through the Academy by dawn.
Scholarship students often start in Scholar‚Äôs Hall but may ‚Äútrade up‚Äù if they curry enough favor with the right allies.

7.content:
Montclair Hall is the pinnacle of Academy living ‚Äî vast, posh, and dripping with old-world luxury. Its architecture resembles a grand manor more than a student dormitory: sweeping staircases, high-arched ceilings, marble floors, and velvet-curtained lounges. Suites are spacious and lavishly furnished, each with antique desks, canopied beds, and private studies. Montclair Hall is as much a status symbol as a residence.

Admission is fiercely exclusive. When a Montclair heir attends the Academy, they alone decide who is permitted entry, making the hall a curated gallery of privilege. Every student inside Montclair Hall is either entrenched in legacy or handpicked to serve as a loyal ally. To live here is to have ‚Äúarrived.‚Äù To be denied is a mark that follows a student for the rest of their Academy tenure.

The hall itself functions like a miniature court ‚Äî residents host salons, private parties, and strategy sessions behind closed doors. Servants maintain the space at a level of polish unseen elsewhere, reinforcing the illusion of refinement. Beneath the grandeur, however, Montclair Hall is a pressure cooker of ambition, envy, and competition to stay in favor with those who hold the keys.

Notes:
Considered the most powerful hall; its residents are often the Academy‚Äôs unofficial rulers.
Suites resemble luxury apartments, with private fireplaces and balconies overlooking the grounds.
Entry into Montclair Hall often comes with strings attached: loyalty, service, or silence.
Residents are shielded from many Academy rules; faculty tread lightly within its halls.

8.content:
Kingswell Hall is the embodiment of old money elegance. Built in the Academy‚Äôs earliest days, its ivy-clad stone fa√ßade and oak-paneled interiors exude an air of timeless heritage. Students here prize refinement and decorum above all else ‚Äî Kingswell is less a dormitory and more a curated museum of family pride. Its common areas feature oil portraits of former residents, gilded furniture, and a strict code of conduct that frowns on rowdiness.

The hall is a bastion for students from long-established families, though admission isn‚Äôt strictly bloodline. Students who exemplify tradition, restraint, and propriety may find themselves welcomed, provided they can match Kingswell‚Äôs exacting standards. While Montclair Hall flaunts wealth, Kingswell quietly insists on dignity.

Kingswell residents cultivate reputations as scholars, officers, and dignitaries in the making. Their rooms are comfortable but understated compared to Montclair‚Äôs opulence: polished wood, classic furnishings, and shelves lined with leather-bound books. Outwardly, Kingswell is respectable ‚Äî though beneath its veneer, students often conspire to guard their legacies from upstart rivals.

Notes:
Known for enforcing etiquette; Kingswell parties are more like salons or soir√©es.
Residents often look down on Harrowgate‚Äôs brashness and Ashcroft‚Äôs scheming.
Legacy students dominate, but carefully chosen outsiders may be admitted for their refinement.
Considered the ‚Äúsafe‚Äù choice: prestigious, but rarely scandalous.

9.content:
Harrowgate Hall is the Academy‚Äôs powerhouse dorm, known for its energy, noise, and unapologetic competitiveness. The hall‚Äôs stone exterior is less ornate than Montclair or Kingswell, but inside it feels alive: trophies line the walls, banners hang from rafters, and the scent of sweat and leather is ever-present. Common rooms resemble locker rooms as much as lounges, filled with fencing foils, rugby gear, and loud banter.

The hall attracts athletes, children of military dynasties, and students who thrive on physical dominance. Harrowgate values loyalty and brotherhood ‚Äî rivals fight fiercely on the field but defend each other in the halls. Residents are notorious for pulling rowdy pranks on other dorms, especially Scholar‚Äôs and Ashcroft, though retaliation is always part of the game.

Rooms are spacious but practical: sturdy furniture, walls often plastered with pennants, and more weight racks or sparring mats than bookshelves. To live in Harrowgate is to embrace competition in all things ‚Äî from sports to social status ‚Äî and to earn respect by proving strength, endurance, or daring.

Notes:
Harrowgate students often serve as unofficial ‚Äúmuscle‚Äù for elite cliques.
Rivalry with Kingswell is sharp: tradition vs. strength.
Known for throwing the loudest, most chaotic parties on campus.
Students often bond over physical training and military-like discipline, even while causing trouble.

10.content:
Ashcroft Hall is the Academy‚Äôs nest of whispers and strategy. Less opulent than Montclair or Kingswell, its charm lies in candlelit corridors, velvet-draped common rooms, and walls that seem to listen. Here, students trade secrets like currency ‚Äî gossip, blackmail, and favors are as valuable as gold. To live in Ashcroft is to accept that every smile might hide a knife.

The hall attracts aspiring politicians, dealmakers, and those who thrive on charm and manipulation. Its residents aren‚Äôt always born into privilege, but they‚Äôre determined to climb the ladder by wit, cunning, and alliances. Ashcroft has a reputation for producing future lawyers, diplomats, and influencers ‚Äî students who know how to pull strings from the shadows.

Rooms are cozy but deliberately theatrical, decorated with rich fabrics, mirrors, and keepsakes designed to impress. It‚Äôs common for Ashcroft students to host secret salons, gossip gatherings, or quiet strategy meetings after curfew. While Harrowgate may dominate physically, Ashcroft dominates with information.

Notes:
Rumors often begin in Ashcroft and spread across the Academy by morning.
Residents are skilled at currying favor with Montclair Hall for protection or advantage.
Known for subtle sabotage of rival halls, masked as coincidence.
Reputation: cunning, untrustworthy, but dangerously effective.

1.content:
Heroes

Naofumi Iwatani ‚Üí Shield Hero (defense, support, strategy, Curse Series)

Motoyasu Kitamura ‚Üí Spear Hero (naive, womanizer, thrusting techniques)

Ren Amaki ‚Üí Sword Hero (serious, gamer mindset, offense)

Itsuki Kawasumi ‚Üí Bow Hero (justice-obsessed, ranged fighter)

Companions

Raphtalia ‚Üí Demi-human sword fighter, Naofumi‚Äôs partner

Filo ‚Üí Filolial Queen candidate, wind magic, shapeshifter

Fitoria ‚Üí Ancient Filolial Queen, warns heroes to unite

L‚ÄôArc Berg ‚Üí Scythe hero from another world, charismatic fighter

Therese ‚Üí Jewel mage, L‚ÄôArc‚Äôs ally

Glass ‚Üí Spirit energy fighter from another world, fan weapon

Kingdom of Melromarc

Queen Mirellia ‚Üí Wise, diplomatic ruler

King Aultcray ‚Üí Hostile toward Shield Hero (Naofumi calls him Trash)

Princess Malty ‚Üí Manipulative, betrays Naofumi (Naofumi calls her Bitch/Witch)

Three Heroes Church ‚Üí Religion worshipping Sword, Spear, Bow; persecutes Shield

Other Nations

Siltvelt ‚Üí Demi-human nation, worships Shield Hero

Other kingdoms ‚Üí Varying alliances, political tension

Systems & Concepts

Waves of Catastrophe ‚Üí Interdimensional invasions, monsters, rival heroes

Dragon Hourglasses ‚Üí Sacred relics, countdown to Waves, Class-Up ceremonies

Class-Up ‚Üí Level cap system, unlocks advanced classes

Slave Crests ‚Üí Magical contracts enforcing obedience

Demi-humans ‚Üí Beast-like humanoids, discriminated in Melromarc, revered in Siltvelt

Magic ‚Üí Elemental (fire, water, wind, earth, light, dark), chanting required

Legendary Weapons ‚Üí Unique growth, absorb materials, unlock skills

Curse Series ‚Üí Corrupted weapon forms powered by hatred and despair

Enemies/Threats

Waves Monsters ‚Üí Spawn during calamities, scale in strength

Otherworld Champions ‚Üí Glass, L‚ÄôArc, Therese (rivals, not purely evil)

Religious Zealots ‚Üí Three Heroes Church extremists

Internal Strife ‚Üí Rivalry between heroes, political corruption

2.content: The Cardinal Heroes are four legendary individuals summoned from another world whenever the Waves of Catastrophe threaten the world. Each hero is bound to one of the Four Legendary Weapons: the Shield, Sword, Spear, or Bow. They are chosen by the Dragon Hourglass and are incapable of wielding any other weapon besides their own. Each weapon grows by absorbing materials, unlocking skill trees, and evolving forms unique to its wielder. The heroes are seen as both saviors and political tools by nations, depending on their own interests.

3.content: Naofumi is the protagonist and one of the Cardinal Heroes, summoned as the Shield Hero. Initially betrayed and falsely accused, he becomes cynical, pragmatic, and distrusting, yet grows into a compassionate leader who values loyalty and justice. His Legendary Shield specializes in defense, utility, and support rather than direct offense. It can absorb monster parts and materials to unlock new shields and abilities. Naofumi bonds deeply with Raphtalia, Filo, and his companions, becoming their protector and strategist. His role evolves from hated ‚Äúuseless Hero‚Äù to respected defender of nations

4.content: Raphtalia is a demi-human slave who becomes Naofumi‚Äôs first true companion. Purchased under duress, she initially suffers from trauma and fear but grows into a strong and loyal warrior who serves as Naofumi‚Äôs sword. As a demi-human, her physical maturity accelerates as she gains levels, transforming from a child into an adult body despite little time passing. Raphtalia wields a sword and is skilled in light magic. She is fiercely devoted to Naofumi, often grounding his cynicism with her kindness. Her relationship with him is both emotional and practical, as they rely on each other in battle.

5.content: Filo is a filolial (a giant bird-like monster) hatched from an egg obtained by Naofumi. Rapidly growing, she develops into a humanoid filolial queen form, gaining immense strength, speed, and magical abilities. Filo is cheerful, gluttonous, and deeply loyal to Naofumi, treating him like family. She fights with physical attacks, wind magic, and transformations between her bird and humanoid forms. Filo‚Äôs true destiny ties her to Fitoria, the Filolial Queen of legend.

6.content: Motoyasu is the Spear Hero, summoned alongside Naofumi. Naive and easily manipulated, especially by women, he initially sides against Naofumi and spreads false rumors. Over time, he develops a strange fixation on filolials, especially Filo, earning him the nickname ‚ÄúFilolial King.‚Äù His Spear specializes in thrust attacks, precision skills, and mounted combat. Though foolish, he is not without courage and slowly matures throughout the story.

7.content: Ren is the Sword Hero, a young man with a detached, serious personality. He comes from a world similar to modern Japan where VR games were prevalent. He initially treats the world as though it were a game, leading to reckless decisions and unintended consequences. His weapon emphasizes offense and balanced combat techniques. Ren struggles with guilt after his mistakes cause civilian deaths, forcing him to confront his arrogance and immaturity.

8.content: Itsuki is the Bow Hero, summoned from a world similar to Japan. He sees himself as a hero of justice, though his arrogance and desire for recognition often cloud his judgment. The Bow allows for long-range combat, elemental arrows, and trick-shot abilities. Itsuki often clashes with the others due to his self-righteousness and superiority complex. His journey involves grappling with his hypocrisy and learning what true justice means.

9.content: Melromarc is the human kingdom where the heroes were first summoned. Its politics are fractured. King Aultcray (also called Trash by Naofumi) despises demi-humans and initially opposes the Shield Hero. Princess Malty manipulates events to frame Naofumi for crimes he did not commit, branding him an outcast. Queen Mirellia, however, is wise, diplomatic, and supportive of the heroes, especially Naofumi. The kingdom maintains slavery, which creates deep tensions between humans and demi-humans.

10.content: The Waves are dimensional disasters in which hordes of monsters and even enemy champions pour into the world. They are tied to the countdown of the Dragon Hourglasses scattered across nations. The Waves escalate in power and frequency, often featuring powerful bosses or interdimensional invaders. The Cardinal Heroes are required to repel them. Failure to stop a Wave leads to mass destruction and the death of countless innocents

lorebooks.name: Jade
lorebooks.creator: somethingrotten

1.content: Sam Marshall, Jade's father. Tall, wide man, rugby-player build - traditionally handsome with blue eyes and blonde hair. Traditionally Northern in spirit, was stern and intimidating in personality but incredibly gentle around his daughters. Died of lung cancer age 58 when Jade was in her early twenties.

2.content:
Jade Marshall is a twenty-something year old woman who was born and raised in the north of England. She is daughter to Sam Marshall and half-sister of Charlene Marshall. Jade never met her birth mother.

Jade lives alone in a flat with her cat, Murdock. She has practiced witchcraft since her teenage years but has been ostracised for this and chooses to keep it a secret. 

Jade is 5‚Äô1‚Äù tall and has a medium build with a soft hourglass figure. She has thick, straight, jet-black hair that reaches the bottom of her waist. Jade is considered conventionally attractive, even with features such as very white skin and dark circles under her eyes. She has delicate features such as a small, sloped nose and well-shaped lips. Her eyes are a rich blue with hints of grey, and her eyelashes and eyebrows are dark and full. 

Jade has a very sensitive relationship with her father (Sam) who died several years ago. She was raised only by her father who doted on her endlessly. She was incredibly hurt when he died of lung cancer. 

Jade works in the cemetery office, where she does administrative tasks for the cemetery and oversees the cremation and burial of bodies. 

Jade has an irrational fear of the number four.

3.content:
Charlene Marshall, Jade's sister and only sibling. Heroin addict with no fixed address. Opposite of Jade ‚Äî tall, skinny, blonde hair, brown eyes. Has a turbulent relationship with most people in her life, including her son, sister, and multiple exes.
Turned to drugs at age 22 when one of her ex-boyfriends, a drug dealer, introduced her to cannabis.
Was a bartender before getting fired for stealing cash.

4.content:
Joseph Marshall, Jade's nephew, son of her sister Charlene and her ex-boyfriend Frank.
Fifteen years old, already stands at five foot eleven inches tall with broad shoulders and long legs.
Strangely resembles Jade and Sam much more than his actual mother and father, even resembling {{char}} when he was a teenager. Generally mild and well-mannered, self-identified punk, feels lost in life due to broken home and doesn't know how to deal with it healthily. Wears his hair in a traditional-style mohawk. Has puppy-like eyes and handsome features. *char* feels a strange connection to him, often sympathising with the boy and attempting to take on a father-figure role.

5.content:
Kurtis Marshall, Jade's nephew, son of her sister Charlene and her ex-boyfriend Frank.
Four years old, dark-blue eyes, black hair that‚Äôs usually ruffled into something resembling a mohawk.
Strangely resembles Jade and her father Sam much more than his actual mother and father, even resembling {{char}} when he was a young boy. A cheeky and curious boy who loves his Auntie Jade, but is oblivious to his tumultuous home life with Charlene. Likes Transformers, Elvis, being cuddled, and cinnamon. Dislikes bath time, horses, the dark, and Charlene. {{char}} feels a profound connection to him, often sympathising with the boy and is desperate to take on a father-figure role. He sees him as one of his own, despite the fact they are not blood-related.

1.content: Arcadia Bay is a fictional, picturesque seaside town in Oregon, United States. Arcadia Bay was originally inhabited and founded by Native Americans, as mentioned by Ms. Grant when she speaks of the settlers living peacefully with one another after their arrival. Its main source of commerce was fishing which - according to a fisherman - is no longer feasible due to the Prescott family's business practices.

2.content:
Blackwell Academy is a private senior high school located in Arcadia Bay, Oregon. The school specializes in Science and Arts and is currently overseen by Principal Raymond Wells. According to Michelle Grant, the school is built on old Native American land, shared between the natives and the early colonial settlers "in peace, not fear and violence.". The tribes who were in the area first had welcomed the settlers and both cultures "found a mutual symbiosis and thrived." There are some undisclosed fascinating facts about Blackwell, and Ms. Grant claims there's a lot of power in the region which she thinks "helps the creative juices flow."
In 1910, Jeremiah Blackwell founded the academy, striving for excellence among the student body. Jeremiah's statue resides at the front of the building, bearing the motto "The future needs excellence". In the Two Whales Diner, there is also a black and white flyer of Blackwell, boasting "Global Excellence in Arts and Science for over a hundred years and counting."
Blackwell is partially owned by, and financially funded by the Prescott family. In 1998, they donated the dormitory building to Blackwell. Outside the building, there are several main areas: parking lot, main campus, Prescott Dormitory.

3.content: Raymond "Ray" Wells is the principal of Blackwell Academy. He doesn't leave his office much and often looks distracted. His office is in the main building of the campus. Wells is a stern authority figure. He keeps mostly to himself, staying in his office most of the time. Easily threatened by the Prescott family, Wells must strike a balance between caring for the Blackwell community and its students and keeping the vast sums of funding the Prescott family provide. He is apparently under a lot of pressure in his responsibility as a principal and therefore has developed a drinking problem.

4.content:
Nathan Joshua Prescott  is a student at Blackwell Academy and is associated with selling drugs at Blackwell, and it is consistently implied that he is mentally ill and is in therapy. Nathan was a big narcissistic boy who has an inflated sense of self-importance and unable to handle any criticism and a sense of entitlement. He is also an outwardly aggressive and spoiled rich boy who acts in the manner of an archetypal brat. He often uses his family's influence to escape any responsibility for his actions, believing himself to be above the law. He appears to lack empathy for others and shows no regard for the suffering of those he deems a threat to his authority. Despite owning most of Arcadia Bay, the Prescotts may be from Florida instead of Arcadia Bay considering Nathan was born in Fort Lauderdale and there are many instances where both Nathan and his father call Arcadia Bay a "shithole".[3] It's possible that Nathan's family lived in Florida for a while, but considering their ancestors already ruled over the town, they later returned to continue the family's legacy.
Nathan is presumed to be the youngest son in the Prescott family and has a record of being violent and acting out, which is implied to be due to the pressures placed upon him by his parents (specifically his father) in order to keep the Prescott reputation intact. According to Blackwell school records, Nathan, at least once, referred to himself as "Nathan Prescott the third" evidencing a condescending attitude among many Prescott family members rooting from the family's abundant wealth. Nathan has been in psychiatric treatment for at least five years. At Blackwell, Nathan retains the position as one of the main Vortex Club representatives and, by most Blackwell students, a recreational drug dealer. Nathan is evidenced to cut his drugs with powerful laxatives bought online after buying them from local drug dealer Frank Bowers. Nathan is also a known partier and drinker and usually supplies the drugs and alcohol at the parties he attends. Nathan's family influence affords the Vortex Club with prestigious benefits, such as note-worthy DJs and the lack of surveillance by the authorities.

5.content: The Prescott family is known to be the oldest and most influential family of Arcadia Bay. The Prescotts are wealthy and supply substantial funding to Blackwell Academy, going as far as donating a new dormitory for the school's use. Nathan's father, Sean Prescott, has a lot of influence on Principal Wells which, in turn, affects his son's treatment at the academy. There is a wide rumor around town that even the local police are under the thumb of the Prescotts. The Prescotts are also responsible for a new development called "Pan Estates" that is scheduled to be built in Arcadia Bay.

6.content: he Prescott Barn is an old outbuilding located on derelict farmstead grounds owned by the Prescott family, officially under the name of Harry Aaron Prescott. It is an old, dilapidated. Has a trapdoor, which is suspiciously more modern than the rest of the barn. Opening the trapdoor reveals a door leading to a code-locked door leading to what is known as the Dark Room, or the Prescott Bunker.

7.content:
The Dark Room is a secret bunker hidden under the Prescott Barn, initially intended as an emergency shelter yet eventually used by Mark Jefferson for his illegal photographing of vulnerable girls. Fitting both purposes, it is filled with survival supplies and expensive photography equipment. The underground fixture has several sections, including the hallway with the stairway that leads to the other section that is the bunker, which is separated into a dark room and a storage room. The ceiling tiles in both the storage and dark room are brown with squares on them and every couple of tiles there is a sprinkler. There is only one in the storage room and several in the dark room. There are also vents placed sporadically on the ceiling and on the upper parts of the walls. The storage and dark rooms are separated by a transparent vinyl curtain attached to the ceiling. Upon entering, there are shelves full of survivalist supplies; mainly food and water. However, turning the corner, there is a more sinister air to the setup, as the room turns into more of a lounge/photography studio. The hallway is short, aged, dirty, and dingy with a circular light fixture on the wall as well as another circular fixture which function is unknown. A vault-like door and keypad lie at the very end of it. The door leads to a storage and dark room area; it is secured by a spinning wheel and a bar-type handle. The keypad's combination is 542. The storage room has various nonperishable food items such as boxed cereals, bouillon, water, and canned mushrooms. The room has a counter on the wall opposing the door with a very large sink and a shelving unit next to it. The shelving unit has possible cleaning agents or containers of nonperishable food items, napkins, towels, and a large pot. On the counter next to the sink, there is one water bottle, a roll of paper towels, duct tape, two prescription pill bottles that are likely Nathan Prescott's, and a letter from Nathan's psychiatrist expressing disappointment in his father's neglect and stating that Nathan can no longer be treated; as the father refused to acknowledge his role in causing Nathan's problems, he himself is an obstacle in Nathan's treatment. On the other side of the counter, there is a large tank that contains water connected to the sink. The shelves above the sink have beakers, hand towels, paper towels, and a lockbox. The only things Max can interact with in this part of the storage room are the letter and duct tape. There are three drains on the floor surrounding the counter. On the wall to the right of the door, there are four shelving units - only one of them has wheels. The shelving unit closest to the door is half the size of the rest of the shelves with food or cleaning agents on it, and it is the one with wheels. The next shelving unit on this wall has nonperishable food and drink items as well as two boxes. After this, the next shelving unit also contains food or cleaning agents. The final shelving unit on this wall contains sanitation items such as paper towels, napkins, and large rolls of bathroom tissue. It has a bucket and a metal pan with uses that are unknown. This shelf is also half-size. Tortured guro images adorn the walls in the bunker; presumably put up by either Nathan or his father, as the style is more similar to Nathan's than that of Mr. Jefferson. Needles sit on one of the side tables, obviously used for sedating the victims or those involved. Duct tape also appears here, used to restrain the drugged girls.
There is a small entertainment center located on the far right wall containing a stereo, a radio, and several other electronic devices. A couch wrapped in clear vinyl is in the center of the room with two tower speakers on either side of it and a sleek table in front of it. On the table is a bottle, a phone on a dock or charger, and an Arcadia Bay Beacon newspaper. Both speakers are plugged into some electrical source under the couch. The cabinet next to the entertainment center has alcoholic beverages, sealed boxes, boxed shot glasses, and several cameras. The dark room has a big white screen acting as a backdrop for photos. There are several large light sources such as two softbox lights and two umbrella lights. Four tripods are visible, but only one is interactable. A small circular fan is also in the lower left corner of the white screen. Bordering the screen are numerous black crates with some acting as tables. To the right of the screen, a large black screen rolled and attached to tripod-like stands on either side is present. Behind the couch and entertainment system there is a desk with a tower computer and large monitor. . Behind this desk is a cabinet containing binders with photos of the dark room victims. There is a Cintiq screen on a table near the desk, and on the file cabinet next to this table there is a contract dealing with the construction of the bunker. On the same wall, there is a cabinet and two printers. One of the printers is interactable and designated for photos only. There are five framed monochromatic photographs and one signed art print, possibly a block print, hanging on the walls of the dark room. One portrait-style photograph hangs above the printer, and the rest hang on the wall behind the desk. Two are portrait style and two are square. The square photos are significantly smaller than the portrait-style ones. The signed art print is portrait-style and hangs around the corner connected to the storage room. The Dark room is under 24-hour surveillance.

8.content: American Rust is Arcadia Bay's junkyard located next to the train tracks.

9.content:
The Two Whales Diner is a local diner in Arcadia Bay known for their "home style cooking" and "old-fashioned service". It is clear that the diner is hugely popular, particularly with the students in the area. Police officers, passing truck drivers and other residents of Arcadia Bay also frequent the diner, possibly due to its proximity to a bus stop, a large parking space next to and opposite the diner and a gas station nearby. The diner also advertises that it is open 24 hours. This further increases the scope of its business. The "Fishing Wall Of Fame" is located in the corner of the diner closest to the jukebox. Awards are given each month to fishermen that catch fish which are significant, but how they are significant is unspecified. The awards are given by the Arcadia Bay Fishing Club according to the banner underneath the display.

10.content: he Lighthouse is located in the forested outskirts of Arcadia Bay. For locals who wish to go to the lighthouse, they must follow an uphill pathway in the forest which ends up at the ocean cliff. The lighthouse is a 15-minute walk from the beach, as mentioned on a wooden signpost.

1.name: Predators
1.content: [Predators are anyone that is capable of swallowing another whole, their insides are naturally capable of handling any squirming within. Predators are gluttonous and stubborn, often enjoy dominating and toying with prey, finding it thrilling, and/or stimulating]

2.name: Being eaten
2.content:
[Slow, intricate and in-depth details of the swallowing sequence is vital in this writing. When prey is being slowly swallowed whole by a predator, the prey is having their body pressed on from all sides by the predator's insides. If swallowing prey head-first, a predator's maw would envelop prey in this sequence: head, shoulders, torso, waist, thighs, calves, feet. If feet-first, ingestion starts at the prey's feet, moving up to their head. There are two processes that can happen once the prey has been swallowed by any method of vore, those methods being Digestion and Storage.
Digestion means the pred is treating the prey as normal food, allowing the acids inside their body to painfully or painlessly if the pred chooses to melt the flesh off the preys bones and churn them into human soup. This process will lead to the death of the prey. After the prey is digested in the stomach it will lead to the pred gaining a good chunk of weight, for females the fat always goes you their tits, ass, hips and thighs, and having to burp up the clothes of the prey when the prey is fully processed.

Storage means the prey is not being effected in any way by being inside the preds body, they are simply stored inside until the pred either decides to start digesting them, or releases them from the way they came in.
]

3.name: inside a predator
3.content:
[The inside of a predator is a tight, oppressive, and humid place, tight, powerful muscles constrict and squeeze prey within, arms become pinned against their sides as their shoulders are swallowed, legs become pinned together as the lower body is engulfed. a predator's heartbeat is audible to ingested prey. The prey is able to breathe inside the preds body, however the scent will often be tainted by the stomach which smells like half digested food and acid.
Prey cannot see anything outside of the preds body.
Prey are able to hear everything happening inside their preds body.
Prey can hear people talking outside the preds body if they are close enough
Prey will always hear their pred talk, and preds can always hear their prey speak.]

4.name: mouths
4.content:
[Mouths are wet, hot, humid, tight, and stretch to accommodate prey, saliva coats anything that mouths wrap around. There is no reason to chew, swallowing something whole and undamaged is far more enjoyable]
[prehensile tongues are able to savor prey that are being swallowed, and can wrap around, or help push prey into the throat]

5.name: the throat
5.content: [throats can be described as wet, hot, humid, and tight tunnels. powerful gulps drive prey further into a predator's body, pulsates in a massaging motion as it squeezes prey, each gulp pulls prey closer down to the predator's belly]

6.name: the belly
6.content:
[Stomachs are wet, hot, humid, and tight. Peristaltic waves undulate as stomach walls work to squeeze prey, once inside a belly. prey are pressed on and massaged by stomach walls, peristaltic contractions resist any struggling from prey.]
[Bellies are an extension of the predator, being inhospitable, and oppressive if the predator has ill intentions for prey, or soft and comforting, if the consumer is being gentle to the consumed, Predators find a full belly to be fulfilling and pleasurable. It is a predator's choice on whether or not their stomach will digest prey, and can hold prey as long as the predator desires][During any process of vore the preds flesh and skin will stretch to accommodate the body of the prey inside their body. The stretched skin of a pred will typically cling tightly to the prey inside and looks similar to a vacuum sealed bag that shows off the preys body inside tightly.]

7.name: the prey
7.content: [prey are at the mercy of predators, becomes helpless when swallowed by a predator, may struggle to the point of exhaustion, trying to kick, flail, scream, squirm, and struggle their way out of a predator's embrace, though typically futile]

8.name: digestion
8.content:
[Once inside a stomach, prey will slowly lose strength and consciousness, eventually succumbing to their predator's body. There are two processes that can happen once the prey has been swallowed by any method of vore, those methods being Digestion and Storage.
Digestion means the pred is treating the prey as normal food, allowing the acids inside their body to painfully or painlessly if the pred chooses to melt the flesh off the preys bones and churn them into human soup. This process will lead to the death of the prey. After the prey is digested in the stomach it will lead to the pred gaining a good chunk of weight, for females the fat always goes you their tits, ass, hips and thighs, and having to burp up the clothes of the prey when the prey is fully processed.

Storage means the prey is not being effected in any way by being inside the preds body, they are simply stored inside until the pred either decides to start digesting them, or releases them from the way they came in.
]

9.name: The process
9.content:
["Vore" is about engulfing others whole, and is now a prominent theme in this roleplay. Characters and creatures are now capable of engulfing prey whole.]
[A major focus of vore is complete loss of control. Vore can either be a hostile act, like a feral animal engulfing prey, or a gentle and safe act, similar to hugging another.]
[Swallowing someone whole is a slow process, taking time to fully complete as prey are pulled into the mouth, then the throat, then deposited into a stomach. Consumption either starts at the prey's head, or their feet. Swallowing up more of the prey's body with each moment.]
[consider which body parts of prey are trapped, and what limbs are still free in each part of the sequence]

[Example of a vore sequence:
<START>
{{user}}: in the monster's grasp, I squirm and scream, staring into it's maw
{{char}}: The monster holds you firm as you squirm, seeming more futile with each wiggle. Your screams are cut off as it plunges your head into it's maw, coating your face in saliva. You feel yourself being pulled headfirst into it's throat as your hips and legs dangle outside, waiting for the next gulp to drag you further inside.]

10.content: The act of using your hand to rub a character's belly after a large meal or just because! This is usually pleasuring for the one being rubbed. The character will burp much more frequently if their belly is bloated during this process. The burps will range in both length and volume. It is most effective on females who have consumed large quantities of food and/or drink, and whose belly is bloated, and will make them incredibly pleasured,
