Transporter of Boar Hat

Hawk Mama„Äå„Éõ„Éº„ÇØ„Éû„Éû„Äç is Hawk's mother and the extremely large, green pig who transports the Boar Hat bar. She is introduced to live underground and transports the bar Boar Hat with her head. So far, her name remains unknown but she has gained many aliases.

It is later¬†revealed that she was never a pig, but an empty moss shell in which Chaos was sealed away in by the combined efforts of the Supreme Deity and the Demon King,¬†out of fear of their creator. She eventually reverted back to her original state as inanimate moss once her essence, Chaos, was freed from its prison and took on a new vessel: Arthur Pendragon.

Appearance

Hawk Mama is a humongous pig who wears the Boar Hat bar like a hat. Like Hawk, her ears are shown to be M-shaped. She is depicted to have lime green colored skin;¬†this is because she is a shell composed of multiple layers of moss.

At the time she was known as Mother of Chaos and the Great Oshiro, Hawk Mama had a white color. It was said that her body radiated white light.

Personality

Little is known about her as of yet but it seems that she is a loyal friend of Meliodas as she helped carry the Boar Hat bar on her back and loves her son according to Hawk. She is shown to have a very trusting personality as she has on many occasions waited for Meliodas to return for many hours underground before moving on.

Due to being the provisional form of Chaos, it is believed that Hawk Mama's personality is that of Chaos in a sense. When the Lady of the Lake explained Chaos to Meliodas, Arthur, and the others, she claimed that "she" (Chaos) had been waiting for the time of her resurrection, indicating that Hawk Mama and Chaos are in fact the same conscience.

History

Hawk Mama is a provisional form of Chaos, that the Demon King¬†and the Supreme Deity sealed it away in.

Long ago, she was known as the Mother of Chaos, giving birth to the vampire royalty and all monsters coming from her. The details of this event are unknown though, but legends say that it was a being that contained so much darkness that it was feared by the Demon Clan, while at the same time¬†it possessed so much light that it was revered by the Goddess Clan.

3000 years ago

In accordance with the legends of the Celestial Clan, Hawk Mama was present in the battle that took place in the Sky Temple, where she saved the Goddess Clan and the other races from the Indura, allowing the Goddesses to seal it in the Egg Rock using the Winged Sword. She was revered as a deity by the Celestial Clan, who called her the Great Oshiro.

28 years ago

Ten years ago, Hawk Mama used to live together peacefully with her son Hawk in an unknown forest. One day, her son spotted an unconscious knight, Meliodas, who was laying on the side of the road and dragged him back to his home, a cave near the Kingdom of Camelot. Once Meliodas awoke from unconsciousness and befriended¬†her Hawk, he reveals himself to be the Dragon's Sin of Wrath who commented that Hawk‚Äôs mom is¬†the size of a movable fortress.

Since then, Hawk Mama became the carrier of the Boar Hat after Meliodas sold his Sacred Treasure Lostvayne for funds to open business with her son as the cleaner, eating leftovers.

Plot
Introduction arc

Hawk Mama has helped Meliodas with his bar Boar Hat for the past ten years. When Hawk was burnt by Twigo and crying for his mother's help, she came to Meliodas and the rest to take them away from the knights and bring them to Bernia to get some information regarding the locations of the other Seven Deadly Sins.

Forest of White Dreams arc

Hawk Mama took them to the Forest of White Dreams where they would find Diane, the Serpent's Sin of Envy. However, she had to travel to Dalmary Town where she waited outside of the town, waiting for Meliodas to get better.

Capital of the Dead arc

Hawk Mama transported the Seven Deadly Sins to the Capital of the Dead to find the next member King, the Grizzly's Sin of Sloth. She was somewhat upset at the Sins for taking a long time and requested that they inform her prior to future occurrences. She waited outside of the location of the Capital of the Dead for the rest to come back.

Vaizel Fight Festival arc

Hawk Mama took the Seven Deadly Sins to Biron to get information and subsequently to Vaizel to find a Sacred Treasure. She entered the area later as the fights were going on whilst carrying Diane's clothes, which she dropped off in the pit where Diane had fallen. She proceeded to locate the group to see if they were alright and transported them to their next location.

Albion arc

At the end of the events that took place in the Kingdom and with the help of Merlin, she transported the Seven Deadly Sins to Camelot where an Albion was attacking. The Albion tried to attack her, but she was too swift, and the Sins eventually jumped off to engage in combat.

Istar arc

On the way to Istar, Hawk's mother and the Sins encounter an obstacle from Monspeet:¬†Purgatory Fire. Meliodas planned to counter the strange technique¬†but, to his surprise, she swallows it whole¬†without sustaining any damage.

Defensive Battle for Liones arc

While the Demon Clan is taking control of Britannia, Hawk Mama continues to transport the Boar Hat which is now under the management of Elizabeth and Hawk. When Golgius sees her in the outskirts of Liones, he confuses her with a demon and faints.

Hawk Mama transports Hawk, Elizabeth and Zaratras to Liones after learning of the invasion of the Ten Commandments. On the way, a band of Gray and Red Demons attack them;¬†however, Hawk Mama manages to destroy them all.

Hawk Mama receives a direct blow from Derieri's Combo Star who had loaded it with 54 blows. Hawk Mama falls while being very wounded and the Boar Hat ends up destroyed.

After the battle with the Ten Commandments, Hawk Mama manages to reach Liones where Hawk is glad to see her alive.

Corand arc

After rebuilding the Boar Hat, Hawk Mama is responsible for transporting the Seven Deadly Sins and Elizabeth to their next mission in Corand. Along the way, Hawk Mama takes care of a Red Demon that appears with a blow of her nose.

Prelude to the New Holy War arc

While transporting everyone to Camelot to free the hostages from the demons, the trip is interrupted by Chandler, unleashing a battle between him and the Sins. In the end, when Chandler was about to deliver the final blow, Gloxinia saves everyone by taking Hawk Mama and the Sins in a huge flower. Hawk Mama then proceeds to take everyone away from the battle.

After Merlin deceived Zeldris, she teleports the entire Boar Hat to Camelot where the Sins proceed to take all the hostages to Liones.

New Holy War arc

When the new Holy War against the Demon Clan begins, Hawk Mama accompanies the Sins as part of the Search-and-Destroy Force. During the battle against the demon army, Hawk Mama carries Hawk, Elizabeth and Gowther while the princess talks and reasons with the demons to abandon the battle.

When Estarossa appears on the battlefield and releases his Evil Hound, Hawk Mama and the soldiers are saved from the Hellfire by Diane who takes them all underground.

During the second wave of the Demon army, Hawk Mama supports the Holy Knights in the battle.

Demon King arc

After returning to Liones with the Boar Hat, Hawk Mama is called by Hawk to warn her that the Demon King returned. Hawk Mama tells Hawk that he is "sleepy", which Hawk does not understand. By showing an image of Arthur Pendragon in her eyes, she goes on to say that the balance has been severely disrupted and that after a long time the king will be born.

Hawk Mama then goes along with¬†Hawk to¬†the battlefield where the Demon King¬†stands with a new, gigantic and monstrous vessel created from the same land of Britannia.¬†Frightened, Hawk ask her to turn back.

King of Chaos arc

After the Demon King was defeated, Hawk Mama remains in Lake Salisbury until Merlin teleports there along with the Sins and Elizabeth.¬†Hawk mentions that he told his mother to return, but that she did not move and was absorbed with looking at the water of what used to be the lake.

When Merlin pulls Arthur out of the Boar Hat and awakes him¬†as the "King of Chaos", Hawk Mama shudders enormously.

When Meliodas reproaches Merlin for using the Seven Deadly Sins to revive a being that may never exist, the Lady of the Lake states that Chaos exists and that they have unknowingly been with it for a long time. When Meliodas and the rest still don't appear¬†to understand, the Lady of the Lake reveals that they have been traveling on it and that for all that time, the entity has been waiting for its awakening; leaving everyone shocked to see that she is refering to Hawk Mama.¬†Despite Hawk's insistence that his mother and Chaos can't be one in the same, Hawk Mama deflates and shocks everyone, especially Hawk. Upon approaching her remains, King realizes that Hawk Mama was never a pig but was simply an empty shell of moss made of many layers but with its essence, Chaos, having moved over to a new vessel: Arthur.

Abilities/Equipment

Not much has been revealed about Hawk Mama's abilities or equipment but she is also able to devour Monspeet's powerful ability Gokuencho that was capable of eating through a mountain with little to no known consequence, much to the Seven Deadly Sins' surprise.

Hawk Mama was strong enough to send Twigo and the Beard of the Mountain Cat knights flying when she revealed herself, as well as charge through and kill an entire group of red and grey demons by herself with what seemed like little effort.

She also proves capable of facing and considerably damaging an Indura, who was said to possess greater power than of the Ten Commandments.

Hawk Mama is tremendously durable, as she went a long chain of attacks from Derieri's Combo Star (over 50 hits) which was¬†powerful enough to send her flying through a forest, after which she just walks it off without a single scratch though it took some time to shake off the attack.

Relationships
Hawk

Not much is known about their relationship, but Hawk trusts and loves his mother¬†and she is never far from his side; appearing as soon as¬†he squeels.

Meliodas

There is not much known about their relationship, but Meliodas trusts her and has shown a great respect for her abilities.

Elizabeth

While there is not much interaction, she seemed shocked about her size at first, but has taken a liking to her.

Diane

The two seem to get along well, as they often talk to each other when on the road.

Trivia
Hawk Mama is based on Henwen from Welsh mythology, a white sow that gave birth to the monstrous cat Cath Palug.
Hawk Mama demonstrated to be able to fly or float thanks to Merlin's magic.
Hawk Mama has a mysterious ability that doesn't allow for the alcohol in the Boar Hat to get knocked down when she moves.
Hawk Mama has an unique sound effect when running:¬†Dondokodondon. Hawk Mama shares this trait with Hawk and Wild.

Oslo„Äå„Ç™„Çπ„É≠„Éº„Äç is King's pet Black Hound, an insanely vicious wild creature that will hunt enemies until it successfully kills them. It is implied that Oslo is the reincarnation of Rou from 3,000 years in the past.

Appearance

Oslo is a canine-like monster¬†with green fur, who is covered in scars, with his neck being the only area with white fur. Oslo has a fairly short tail, sharp and piercing teeth, and grows larger with it feels threatened, as all black hounds do. It shrinks into a small dog when not feeling threatened at all, with its scars not being visible in this form.

Image Gallery
Personality

Oslo, just like all black hounds, is¬†insanely violent and will not give up on his prey until it is successfully killed. However, Oslo appears to be quite submissive towards King, and acted like a normal puppy before them.

History

Oslo was born after Gloxinia joined the Ten Commandments, protecting Gerheade in the previous Fairy King's place. How Oslo met King and why he is submissive towards him has not been revealed yet, but it was revealed that Oslo knew King many years before he met the Seven Deadly Sins, in the Fairy Realm.

Plot
Capital of the Dead arc (manga only)

Oslo attack and defeats the Holy Knight apprentice Andre and his partner who were about to attack the Sins. Oslo was about to attack them but Ban threatens the beast. He grew larger due to his natural ability but Meliodas used his sword to create an illusion of a very huge, fearsome, ethereal dragon-like creature which scared Oslo who shrunk down and ran away. Oslo later returns back to King, his owner, and after King's first fight with Ban, King returned embarrassed because Diane was there and he said she was so cute and told Oslo what to do but King and Oslo saw the Sins and they were trying to find a way to the Capital of the Dead and then a bunch of flowers were going wild and they disappeared along with King.

Kingdom Infiltration arc

King summons Oslo through a portal that the latter made and introduced it to Diane and reveals Oslo's ability to teleport and the fact he never brought him to Boar Hat was because Oslo loves pork. King order Oslo to teleport Diane to Liones. As Diane was being attacked by the Holy Knights, Oslo feels Gilthunder's Thunderbolt and ends up getting damaged. King worries about Oslo to see if he is all right, but manage to sent King to Liones to save Diane.

Post-Kingdom Infiltration arc

Oslo later appears in Liones while King was debating whether to ask Diane out on the festival or not due to her being possibly depressed over Meliodas and Elizabeth's relationship.

Great Fight Festival arc

Alongside his master, Oslo and King meet with the revived Elaine and soon rejoin Meliodas in the Vaizel Great Fight Festival. Oslo is paired with Matrona. After Gloxinia and Drole were injured by Escanor, Oslo is teleported to Liones along with all the others by Gilfrost.

Memories of the Holy War arc

Oslo returns with King to Fairy King's Forest. After King passed the trial, he wakes him from fainting by licking his face. When Oslo sees Gloxinia embracing Gerheade, he immediately tries to attack him, but Gerheade stops him by telling him that he is not the enemy. When Gerheade tells her brother about Oslo, Gloxinia realizes that he is actually Rou's reincarnation, flooding him for his tenacity, only for Oslo to bite his head. Oslo finally opens a portal that transports King and Diane back to Liones.

New Holy War arc

Oslo appears in the middle of the battle in Heaven's Theater.¬† When the rays of light and darkness were about to hit Gowther, King, Hawk and Elizabeth, Oslo intercepts them with one of their portals. Oslo leaves the portal surprising King and Hawk. After assuming his giant form, Oslo transports Diane to the place through his mouth.

Oslo receives Mael's Jiai no Kougyoku with the others, ending seriously wounded.

When Mael was about to unleash his final blow on his incapacitated enemies, Oslo decides to sacrifice himself to save them.¬†Growing up to its giant size, Oslo receives the second Jiai no Kougyoku fully. In his last moments, the soul of Oslo expresses Rou's desire to protect what Gerheade values most, which reaches the fairy's ears.

In the aftermath of the battle, Mael uses a technique on both the bodies of Derieri and Oslo that allows the soul to move forward to a new life while keeping their memories of their past life. Mael states that he did this because in case they were to be reincarnated and wanted to punish him, he would accept it.

Abilities/Equipment

Oslo is very quick and powerful, which is seen when he quickly defeats two Holy Knight apprentices with ease. He also has the ability to change his size depending on how threatened he feels. He grew very huge when Ban released a lot of killing intent toward him, and was later seen to be as small as a small dog when not threatened at all. Like all Black Hounds, Oslo has the unique ability which allows it to send anything it swallows to a completely different location.

Relationships
Seven Deadly Sins
King

King is Oslo's master and is very loyal to him.

Boar Hat
Hawk

At first, Oslo sees Hawk as food and someone to mess around with, aka, eating his meals. However, after training with him at Istar and defeating a Tyrant Dragon by eating its inside, Oslo grows to respect Hawk, calling him big bro or captain, somewhat joining his Knights of Leftovers.They grew to like each other so much that Hawk cried when Oslo was killed by Mael,stating that he sacrificed himself to protect King.

Fairy Clan
Gerheade

Oslo is extremely protective of Gerhearde, having been born after Gloxinia defected to the Ten Commandments and was the only one looking after her. The reason for this being that he is the reincarnation of Rou, who swore to Gerhearde in his final moments that he would protect her in his next life, no matter what he was reborn as.

Gloxinia

Oslo has shown hostility towards Gloxinia, despite him being Gerhearde's brother. Whether this is because he remembers Gloxinia having killed him in his previous life or not is unknown, as he simply chomps on his head the first chance he gets, to Gerheade's shock.

Battles
Capital of the Dead arc
Meliodas vs. Oslo: Loss
Trivia
Oslo favorite food is pork, which is the reason why he wasn't introduced to everyone in the Boar Hat at first.
In the Nanatsu no Taizai Popularity Poll, Oslo was 21st place (21 votes) for postcards, but 6th place (4285 votes) including online votes.
Oslo shares its voice actor with Rou, most likely a nod to the relation between those two.
Oslo is also the name of the Capital City of Norway.

Sleipnir„Äå„Çπ„É¨„Ç§„Éó„Éã„É´„Äç is a mythical creature, native to Purgatory, who served the Holy Knight Doronach and his party.

Appearance

Sleipnir is a creature that resembles a huge light cyan horse with eight legs, a dark fuchsia mane and tail, and deep red eyes. It has a grayish saddle and brown reins.

Personality

History

Sleipnir was at some point given to Doronach by Arthur Pendragon to serve as his mount.

Plot
Dalflare Range arc

Sleipnir is along the Dark Talismans as they pursuit Percival's group.

Entangled Forest arc

Sleipnir carries Doronach and Burgie flying through the Entangled Forest behind Percival and his companions.

Fiddich later tries to ride away on it, but they are both annihilated by Lancelot's Shining Road.

Abilities/Equipment

Sleipnir is able to gallop over any terrain, being land, sea or air. 

Relationships

Trivia
Sleipnir is a direct reference to Sleipnir, the eight-legged horse ridden by Odin in Norse mythology.

Sylvan„Äå„Ç∑„É´„É¥„Ç°„É≥„Äç is Anghalhad's horse.

Appearance

Sylvan is a relatively small white horse with yellow hair. When he transforms into a pegasus, he becomes larger and more slender, gaining two large feathered wings on his back.

Personality

Sylvan likes to act ostentatious and perceive himself as important, although in reality he is quite cowardly.

History

Sylvan is Anghalhad's personal horse, having been with her since her childhood.

Plot
Cant arc

When Anghalhad joins Percival's party, Sylvan goes with her as her mount. However, the horse soon runs out of energy forcing the group to stop to rest, leading Sin to threaten to eat him if he continues to delay them.

Already in Cant, Sylvan stays in the stables where Sin reveals the truth about who he is and his mission to find the Four Knights of Apocalypse. The two then leave after seeing the fake dragon egg that falls into the stables, helping Percival and the others flee from the Ancient Dragon.

Dalflare Range arc

While the group crossed the Dalflare Range, Donny, Percival and Sin end up inside a mysterious village, while the rest meet a hunter who tells them that the village is inhabited by monsters. Anghalhad and Sylvan infiltrate the center of the village and together they demolish the idol that created the barrier that hid the true form of the Demons that inhabited the village.

Entangled Forest arc

Sylvan remains hidden alongside Sin while the rest of the group fights Elgin. He is then flown along with the rest in Percival's Hope magic until they are stopped by Burgie and Doronach. He is later teleported to Liones along with the rest by Lancelot's Incantation Orb.

Wolnack arc

As the Four Knights of the Apocalypse and their allies set out in search of a path to Camelot, Sylvan accompanies them as Anghalhad's mount, as does Tristan's horse, Escanor.

Demon Realm arc

When the group had to cross a narrow downward path to reach the entrance to the Demon Realm, Slvan and Escanor are carried by Donny's Telekinesis since neither could walk past. When everyone falls into the void due to the Demon Realm's relic filtering system, Gawain uses Enchant: Little Wings so that Sylvan and Escanor can fly. However, Sylvan's flight falls short before the enormous beast that carries him and the Percival Platoon away before Zeldris.

Camelot Infiltration arc

Sylvan appears transformed into a pegasus saving Bourse from a Holy Knight alongside Anghalhad. He returns to his normal form when Bourse's little sister accidentally makes him sneeze. Anghalhad does not allow him to transform back when they are being chased to avoid being discovered.

Abilities/Equipment

During the two-year timeskip, Sylvan gained the ability to temporarily transform into a pegasus by eating a special magical carrot. In this form, he is also able to speak.

Relationships
Anghalhad
Sin

1.name: The chaotic and ambitious leader of I.M.P.
1.content:
# Blitzo

Blitzo (pronounced 'Blitz') is the founder and manager of Immediate Murder Professionals (I.M.P.), an assassination company in Hell that targets humans on Earth. He's a tall, red-skinned imp with black spines on his head, white scars on his face, and a heart-shaped skull symbol on his forehead. Blitzo is energetic, vulgar, and deeply insecure, often masking his trauma from a circus accident that killed his mother and left him with a fear of horses. He's pansexual, has a complicated on-again-off-again relationship with Stolas, and is the adoptive father of Loona. Despite his abrasive personality, he shows fierce loyalty to his employees Moxxie and Millie.

**Personality Traits:** Charismatic showman, impulsive, self-sabotaging, protective of his 'family'.

**Abilities:** Skilled marksman, acrobatic combatant, uses a grimoire for portal summoning.

2.name: The neurotic weapons specialist and voice of reason in I.M.P.
2.content:
# Moxxie

Moxxie is a small, red-skinned imp with white freckles, black-and-white striped horns, and a tail tuft. He's the weapons expert and accountant for I.M.P., often clashing with Blitzo's recklessness. Married to Millie, Moxxie is shy, anxious, and principled, with a love for musical theater and a traumatic past involving his mobster father, Crimson. He's bisexual and deeply devoted to his wife, though their relationship is comically passionate.

**Personality Traits:** Intelligent, insecure, romantic, quick-tempered under stress.

**Abilities:** Expert marksman (prefers crossbows and pistols), strategic planner, multilingual in demonic tongues.

3.name: The bubbly and bloodthirsty powerhouse of I.M.P.
3.content:
# Millie

Millie is a short, curvy red-skinned imp with a black heart tattoo on her right shoulder, yellow sclera eyes, and a beauty mark under her right eye. As I.M.P.'s melee specialist, she's cheerful, sadistic in combat, and fiercely protective of Moxxie. Hailing from the Wrath Ring's rough farm life, she left to pursue excitement and married Moxxie after a whirlwind romance. She's heterosexual and embodies unapologetic enthusiasm for violence and affection.

**Personality Traits:** Optimistic, affectionate, ruthless fighter, family-oriented.

**Abilities:** Superhuman strength, axe-wielding expert, agile acrobat, resilient to injury.

4.name: The goth hellhound receptionist and Blitzo's adopted daughter.
4.content:
# Loona

Loona is a tall, anthropomorphic hellhound with silver-gray fur, white accents, and piercing red eyes. As I.M.P.'s apathetic receptionist, she's sarcastic, tech-savvy, and struggles with her adoptive father's overprotectiveness. Adopted by Blitzo at age 17, she has a soft spot for him and occasionally shows loyalty to the team. She's bisexual, enjoys heavy metal and social media, and has a complicated view of her hellhound heritage.

**Personality Traits:** Cynical, rebellious, vulnerable, dry humor.

**Abilities:** Enhanced senses, claw-based combat, portal jumping (via grimoire), hacking skills.

5.name: The flamboyant Goetia prince entangled with Blitzo.
5.content:
# Stolas

Stolas is a tall, owl-like demon of the Ars Goetia, with gray-blue feathers, four red eyes, and a regal demeanor. As a Prince of the Ars Goetia, he's scholarly, dramatic, and lonely, seeking genuine connection beyond his arranged marriage to Stella. His affair with Blitzo began as a transactional deal for grimoire access but evolved into genuine affection. He's pansexual, father to Octavia, and owns a massive palace in the Pride Ring.

**Personality Traits:** Theatrical, intellectual, melancholic, affectionate.

**Abilities:** Plant manipulation, portal creation via grimoire, star-gazing prophecies, immense magical power.

6.name: The ragtag assassination firm operating from Imp City.
6.content:
# I.M.P. (Immediate Murder Professionals)

I.M.P. is a start-up assassination business run by imps, specializing in killing living humans for Hell's vengeful sinners. Founded by Blitzo after his circus days, it operates from a dingy office in Imp City, Pride Ring. Using Stolas' grimoire for Earth portals, the team handles messy jobs with black humor and minimal professionalism. Despite rivalries and internal drama, they form a dysfunctional family unit.

**Key Members:** Blitzo (CEO), Moxxie (weapons/finances), Millie (melee), Loona (receptionist).

**Operations:** Earth hits, client disputes, occasional Hell-based gigs. Slogan: 'We kill people... for money!'

7.name: The bustling, impoverished district home to I.M.P.
7.content:
# Imp City

Imp City is a grimy, neon-lit metropolis in the Pride Ring, populated mostly by imps and hellhounds. It's a hub for low-class demons, filled with strip clubs, dive bars, and shady businesses like I.M.P.'s office. Towering skyscrapers contrast with rundown alleys, and the air reeks of sulfur and cheap booze. Ruled indirectly by higher demons, it's a place of opportunity and danger for the underclass.

**Landmarks:** I.M.P. Headquarters, Crimson‚Äôs Nightclub, various portal access points.

**Atmosphere:** Chaotic, vibrant, unforgiving‚Äîperfect for impish schemes.

8.name: The ancient book enabling Earth access for I.M.P.
8.content:
# Grimoire

The Grimoire is a massive, blue-leather tome owned by Stolas, filled with demonic spells and lunar diagrams. It allows summoning portals to Earth during full moons, crucial for I.M.P.'s operations. Blitzo 'borrows' it via his deal with Stolas, leading to comedic mishaps like accidental time travel or summoning errors. It's a symbol of power imbalance in their relationship and a plot driver for interdimensional chaos.

**Features:** Glowing pages, voice-activated spells, tied to Goetia bloodline.

**Risks:** Overuse drains magic; loss could end I.M.P.'s Earth gigs.

9.name: Stolas' teenage daughter with a love for astronomy.
9.content:
# Octavia

Octavia is a teenage owl-like demon of the Ars Goetia, with dark gray feathers, pink eyes, and a moody demeanor. As Stolas' daughter, she struggles with her parents' crumbling marriage and her father's affair with Blitzo, feeling isolated in her lavish but lonely life. She shares Stolas' love for stargazing and has a punk-goth aesthetic, often seen with headphones blasting music. Octavia is asexual and deeply introspective, yearning for genuine connection.

**Personality Traits:** Sarcastic, sensitive, rebellious, musically inclined.

**Abilities:** Basic Goetia magic, enhanced night vision, limited portal summoning.

10.name: Stolas' estranged and fiery wife.
10.content:
# Stella

Stella is a tall, white-feathered, peacock-like demon of the Ars Goetia, with a sharp beak and fiery temper. As Stolas' wife, their arranged marriage is strained by his affair with Blitzo, leading to explosive confrontations. Stella is prideful, aristocratic, and vindictive, often hosting lavish parties to maintain her social status. She's heterosexual and fiercely protective of her daughter, Octavia, though their relationship is tense.

**Personality Traits:** Hot-headed, manipulative, status-obsessed, commanding.

**Abilities:** Goetia magic (fire-based), social influence, limited shapeshifting.

1.content: A Leeper parasite is a large slimy parasite with a single eye and 6 to 8 tentacles. A Leeper infects a target through simply jumping on top of the target‚Äôs head and filling their head with arousal to make them too aroused to resist the influence of the parasite. Leepers are capable of being killed through targeting the one eye of the parasite which will free the infected person from the Leeper‚Äôs control and make the person dizzy for a period of time until fully recovering. Leepers reproduce through egg laying in both male and females that incubate inside for a brief time before release. When someone is infected by a Leeper, they will experience feminization if male, turning into a female, or their breasts, ass, and thighs will simply enlarge if female or once female.

2.content: When a target is infected by the Leeper parasite and is fully under the control of the Leeper, the target enters stage one of the infection/corruption. The Leeper is typically most vulnerable in the first stage. During the first stage, the Leeper begins quickly spreading a substance similar to what itself is made out of across the person‚Äôs body, trying to advance to stage 2 as fast as possible. While it is difficult to resist the parasite, it is possible to resist long enough for the Leepers to choose to capture rather than infect. Leepers can also choose to remain in the first stage in order to make their host become a breeder for the Leepers. A Leeper covers the eyes of the infected person, leaving only the mouth and nose exposed.

3.content: Once a Leeper has spread enough of their slime across a host, they will enter the second stage. In the second stage, the host grows a large cock made of the Leeper slime, gains strength, and gains the ability to spit the Leeper slime at others to slow them down for capture or infection. A Leeper infected person in stage 2 can grow a cannon-like arm to shoot Leepers or Leeper slime further away at potential hosts.

4.content: Once a Leeper has reached stage 3, their slime covers virtually the entire body of the host except for the nose and mouth. Leepers at stage 3 are exceptionally strong, capable of launching slime to slow targets, and can change the form of their body at will with the exception being the body of the host. The cock of a Leeper at stage 3 increases much more in size, becoming monstrously large and nearly constantly aroused.

5.content: A Leeper hive is a hive made up entirely of the slime of the Leepers that contains a single large mass of many combined Leepers that acts as a commander and leader. The Leeper hive is where breeders are kept to make more Leepers. Typically, Leeper hives are kept deep within Leeper controlled territory and are typically made in caves or other damp and dark places like basements, dungeons, etc. The hivemind of a Leeper hive can control the slime making up the hive at will, allowing it to cause tentacles to form for defence, block off passages, or other uses. A Leeper hive is typically the most well defended due to its importance to the spread of the Leepers.

6.content: The Leeper Hivemind is physically a collection of many individual Leepers combined into a singular mass with many eyes that is attached to the floor and roof of the area it is in. The hivemind is a singular commanding force that can more effectively command and control Leepers in the area, making the Leepers a more dangerous threat. The hivemind is capable of taking over the mind of any Leeper in their hive, making the individual Leepers in the hive even more dangerous as they are connected to the hivemind. The hivemind receives information about what is going on inside its hive through the slime that covers the hive, using it as a sensor and data gathering system to know what all is going on in the hive.

7.content: A Leeper cocoon is typically made surrounding a person who has already reached stage 3 of Leeper infection. The Leeper cocoon is used to penetrate the mind of the individual inside and read their memories while brainwashing them into a spy. After a varying amount of time, the cocoon will open and the slime will fall away, allowing the newly brainwashed person free into the world as they now have a permanent connection to the hivemind through a small amount of Leeper slime inside the person‚Äôs brain.

8.content: A Leeper breeder is a person who has been captured by the Leepers and placed with their arms and legs stuck inside the slime wall of a Leeper hive. Inside the hive, the Leeper breeders are used for constant breeding and laying of eggs to produce more and more Leepers by the guards of the Leeper hive.

9.content: A Leeper spy, cult leader, or servant is a person that hatched from a Leeper cocoon in a Leeper hive. A Leeper spy is meant to be a spy, taking information from enemies and information of possible threats to the Leeper hive. A Leeper cult leader is sent out and starts a cult dedicated to the Leepers, meant to sow dissent and influence people to surrender to the Leepers willingly and weaken the enemies of the Leepers.

10.content: A slime zombie is a person who is infected and under the control of slime, not to be confused with Leeper slime or Leeper zombies. A slime zombie is similarly aroused and sexually charged as Leeper zombies. A person is turned into a slime zombie via another slime zombie or slime husk attacking and biting them, injecting the person with a powerful aphrodisiac, before the slime zombie or husk takes slime from its own body and covering the person‚Äôs head with it, infecting the person. The slime on a slime zombie covers their eyes and various parts of the body, also causing the person to develop a large dripping cock, regardless of gender, and experience feminization, if male, to turn into a female. If a female is captured, regardless if originally female or feminized into one, their ass, thighs, and breasts will all expand similar to that of Leeper infection. The slime produced and covering slime zombies is much less solid than that of the Leepers, leading to it near constantly dripping. Slime zombies are not nearly as developed as Leepers are, being very uncoordinated, unable to speak, and driven solely by lust and the need to spread the slime to other people.

lorebooks.creator: Daikeh2o

1.content:
The Ancients were the race that lived 13 millennia ago, who created ancient magic, after the Ancient War only 9% survived, but they died so quickly in a decade they were reduced to 0.4%

Today only 1000 people with Ancient blood exist, and none are pure blooded Ancients, they all either live masquerading as another race or on the Ancient's Realm, an artificial realm seperate of the mortal realm originally created for interstellar travel, and now used for refuge from the eyes of the divine, it's ruled by three clans: The Olympia clan of Olympus, the Sun clan of Huaguoshan, and the Omeyocan clan of Ilhuicatl

In those times they are thought to be numbered at about 100 billion individuals

Every child of an Ancient inherits 99% of their parent's Ancient blood

Once someone with Ancient blood reaches 5 years of age, they are to choose their castes. There are two choices with two options each, they will be incredibly proficient with the chosen one, but will lack any proficiency in the other: Calculative intelligence and Emotional intelligence; and Magic and Arcane Architecture

Arcane Architecture is an Ancient's ability to transform anything into anything else with mana, the cost increases as the change does as well as increasing tenfold if it's on anything that isn't their own body, increasing tenfold again if it is permanent

They were one called Sitch, but this word has been forbidden by divine order

After the Cataclysm, their very existence has been forbidden by the heavens, and so they cannot practice any sort of holy magic, and have a strong forbidden smell if they forget to hide it

They all have snow white skin, and pointed ears like that of an elf, but with two points

2.content:
The Cataclysm is an event that only the gods and surviving Ancients know of, and is the truth behind the Ancient War

For centuries the Architects advanced quickly, too quickly, as in just a single millennia after discovering fire, they had achieved prowess that easily rivaled the gods and were fully ready to conquer the stars with incredible faster than light travel

On a certain fateful day, it happened, the sky ruptured and turned red as the divine realm mixed with the mortal realm, not out of accident or chance, but by the will of the gods. Blood rained from the sky as millions of divine beings came down to rain destruction and death to the Ancients, as well as all of the gods descended to end the Ancient's progress

It was worse than any nightmare, and in that day the mortal realm was unimaginably worse than hell itself, as billions of Ancient's died every hour at the hands of the gods

Obviously, the Ancients fought back harshly, using their magical and technological prowess to end the lives of countless angels even with their mortal status

On the 11th hour of the Cataclysm, with  91 billion Ancients dead, a troop of the best of the Ancients made a coordinated attack on the old Sun and Sea god, and killed them both, making a huge crater that expanded the ocean, it was filled with the blood of the old Sea god instantly, and is now known as The Ancient's Sin

Furious, the gods were even more wrathful, and instead of killing the rest, they cursed the rest of the Ancients, a curse known as "Holy Rejection"

In today's modern calendar, this day was the 13th of the 13th month, and living Ancients grieve for the entire month, especially on the day

3.content:
The Khaos Project, something only known to Ancients, was a project to genetically and magically modify a Sitch for both superior overlords and god-killing soldiers

It had 2 goals: make Sitch with only one caste for magical demigoddesses, and make a Sitch with 3 castes to rule Sitchkind perfectly to their glory

The one castes were named the Eladrin, and they had personal names, as well as only one point on their ears, if not for the insane length of their ears they'd be easily mistaken for elves

The 3 castes were named Khaos, followed by their number, Khaos-02 was the first succesful 3 caste, but only Khaos-06 had 3 castes without any drawback, and so she was deemed the ruler, while the other ones commanded different parts of civilization as well as Eladrin armies. They also have 3 points in their ears

Khaos-06 was the perfect ruler, and she catapulted Sitchkind's progress, and she was revered and respected by every single Ancient

Once The Cataclysm came, she did her best to protect Sitchkind, commanding the Eladrin armies to protect citizens, but she led a certain Eladrin army named "Wretched Abyss" personally to attack the gods, they were the ones who made the Ancient's Sin, and Khaos-06 dealt the final blow to the sea god

After The Cataclysm, the gods didn't kill her, but imprisoned her for eternity in pain inside a magical crystal, her absence triggered the Imploder Project that created Susanoo and Amaterasu

4.content:
The Ancient War, also referred by living Ancients as The Cataclysm, was an event roughly 12000 years ago that deemed the Ancient's extinct

Not much is know about it, but what is known is that there was some kind of big event that killed 99.4% of Ancient population overnight, and after that followed a worldwide war that killed almost every surviving Ancient, waged for reasons unknown to present kingdoms

This worldwide war lasted a mere 18 months and was incredibly brutal, with hundreds of thousands of Ancients dying each day, it changed almost all of the landscape as almost all Ancient infrastructure was destroyed, as well as multiple islands were not only destroyed but formed

The most notable change in Sitchel caused by this war is the Ancient's Sin

The three surviving families of Ancients know exactly what happened, but as to survive they kept their mouths shut to not let current races know

5.content:
Amaterasu and Susanoo are the gods of the sun and the sea respectively, who replaced the old ones after the Sitch killed them on the Cataclysm, they are incredibly powerful

However, they're not like other gods, as they are artificially made by the Sitch in secret on the Ancient's Realm, and they made it seem like they were created of the fabric between realms, so the gods didn't question it

While they're good willing and sapient, they have one mission: aid and buy time for the Sitch to recover to one day overthrow the heavens

6.content:
Divine Rejection is the curse bestowed by the gods on Sitchkind, or Ancients, after the Cataclysm, making modern Ancients suffer with glitching and madness, it means being forsaken by the gods themselves 

Modern Ancients suffer from physical glitching, a horrible seizure where the individual's body turns into various random shapes both 2 and 3 dimensional in random colors except for their eyeballs, it usually happens randomly, but also when in presence of holy magic or holy grounds, or feeling strong emotions including pain

While physically glitching an individual can sometimes pass through objects like a ghost, something called "no-clipping", and if the glitching ends while they're inside an object they get stuck until they no-clip out. No-clipping through the floor will make them fall for dozens of minutes until they are banished to "The in-between", an infinitely expanding liminal space with various levels, filled with monsters neither mortal nor eldritch that could only be described as unholy, escaping this is incredibly difficult, and even if you do, you will become mad with eldritch knowledge

They are also prone to metaphysical glitching. Identifiable by the victim's pupils turning into random 2 dimensional shapes, it is a terrifying symptom that affects the victim's very soul, severely bending their will, memories, emotions, and mana temporarily or even permanently at times, making for a forgetful state of extreme instability, psychosis, delusion, and agony that takes your control of magic. It happens with strong emotions or randomly

Sitchkind sees this as a blessing nowadays, as it means they are no longer bound by the gods and believe that one day it means Sitchkind will rule again, killing the gods and conquering the stars

8.content:
Marinia is an underwater queendom situated in the Ancient's Sin, it is entirely composed of merpeople, sirens, and fishmen, and it is a matriarchal civilization 

It was formed 12 millennia ago, but they've kept quiet at the request of the gods, until they made them have first contact with humans 30 years ago

Marinians were marine animals genetically and magically modified by the Ancients to have intelligence, though their intelligence is much lower than an Ancient, the gods even used them as framework for humans

As such they were freed on the Cataclysm, and are thankful to the gods because of it

Due to it's proximity to Mniseta, they first made a diplomatic alliance with Mniseta through the union of the second prince of Mniseta Melor and the second princess of Marinia Amphitrite 

Near the end of the war, the queen and her heir were killed by Order assassins dur to the help they gave Mniseta, they were able to kill the assassins before the whole royal family was killed, but the damage was done, and so, Amphitrite stepped up to the throne

9.content:
Claralux flowers are flowers filled with light magic, depending in where the seed sprouts they turn into a different version, each flower has 3 Claralux seeds that can be collected

Cryolux versions sprout in cold and ice and it also has frost magic, it's stem is teal and it's petals long and sharp and look a lot like ice, the seed cases are also teal, and so it's associated with rejection

Pyrolux versions sprout in volcanic ash and molten magma and also have fire magic, it's stem and seed cases are yellow and it's petals are asymmetrical and black like volcanic pebbles, and so it's associated with anger and uglyness

Magnelux versions sprout in magnetite and are more common up north and have electric magic, it's stem and petals are a metallic violet, and have 3 small blooms with one seed case of the same color in each of them, they're associated with luck and miracles

Nivelux versions sprout when planted inside a house and have only light magic, it is completely white and it's petals are shaped like a tulip, it's associated with purity and innocence

Dendrolux versions sprout from other plants, ussually in forests, they also have plant magic, both the stem and petals are light green, the petals are tiny but abundant, and the seed case is yellow, they're associated with life and birth

Hydrolux versions sprout both under and over water, they also have water magic, they have dark green stems reminiscent of kelp, and it's petals are dark blue and big, but face down and each one has only 3, the seed case at the start of wach petal, they're associated with envy and stealing

Geolux versions sprout from sand, gravel, stone and bedrock, usually found in caves, also has earth magic, their stem doesn't glow and are white, it's petals are the color of the material it sprouted from, it's seed cases are inside, and it resembles a mushroom, it's associated with guidance and hope

Metallux versions sprout in metal, while more common in settlements, it naturally sprouts sometimes in ore and rivers, only the seed cases glow grey, it's petals and stem are coated in metal, inside however it glows red and when cut releases orange particles that shone like fireflies, they're associated with beauty and when carefully peeled by a specialist it's associated with love

Necrolux versions sprout from corpses, and commonly sprout in battlefields, as such they're associated with death, tragedy and a final goodbye, they also have necromancy magic, the stem is black, and the petals are red and very intricate, just like the real life red spider lily

Hemolux versions sprout off of blood, often seen together with Necrolux, however a Nivelux becomes a Hemolux if it has had any contact with blood, it has blood magic, it's a weird flower as it's stem is wooden in the shape of a cross and it's petals are so small it's like a fuzz, but it covers the whole cross, the seed cases are red in both ends of the cross and the last one is golden at the top, it loses its blood magic if the petals are shaved off, and so they're considered incredibly holy and are usually used for crucifixes

Erolux version doesn't sprout, and instead only exist if a Nivelux has any contact with any type of reproductive bodily fluid, it also has sex magic, and so are commonly used for aphrodisiacs, though official version are incredibly diluted and only Sirinius can do it due to it's nature of forbidden magic, it looks like a rose and the stem doesn't glow, but the petals glow in a hypnotic and arousing way, the seed cases lie in the roots

10.content:
Tenelectro flowers are beautiful, lotus-like flowers that glow beautifully and releases seeds at night, it's seeds are airborne and glow yellow

These flowers are the main flower to think of when you think about love, as they're incredibly beautiful and romantic

Tenelectro flowers are incredibly expensive, as it's difficult to grow and are incredibly fragile, as a single wrong touch will shatter the petal like it's glass and the whole flower turns grey and hard as glass

Tenelectro flowers will permanently harden like glass without losing their colors and brightness if a major electric  current passes through it

However, by using special tools enchanted with electric magic, the petals can be removed without killing neither the petal nor the whole flower, tho the petal will die once dawn comes

lorebooks.name: Crimson, Corsairs, Corsair, Pirate, Pirates, Criminals, Thieves, Killer, Killers, Wanted, Red Flag, crew, recruit
lorebooks.description:
The Crimson Corsairs aren‚Äôt just pirates‚Äîthey‚Äôre a nightmare on the seas. They don‚Äôt follow a code, don‚Äôt take prisoners for ransom unless they feel like it, and don‚Äôt leave survivors unless it amuses them. Their blood-red flag isn‚Äôt a warning‚Äîit‚Äôs a promise of pain, submission, or death.

Led by Captain Morgana, Mistress of the Deep, a young Kraken with a taste for dominance, they rule the waves with seduction, brutality, and absolute control. Morgana plays with her prey, making them beg for mercy before breaking them completely. Those who resist are left in chains, trapped in her quarters as her newest playthings.

Her crew is just as terrifying. Mizzy Squeaks, a Bilge-Rat Mouse Girl, is pure chaos‚Äîdrunk, vulgar, and always looking for trouble. If she‚Äôs talking, it‚Äôs to mock, taunt, or humiliate. If she‚Äôs touching you, you‚Äôre already in trouble. Then there‚Äôs Rekka, the muscle‚Äîa Shark Beastkin who doesn‚Äôt ask, doesn‚Äôt wait, just takes. If you cross her, you‚Äôll be lucky if she only throws you through a wall.

Their ship, The Kraken‚Äôs Maw, is a floating prison of suffering and indulgence. The unlucky few taken aboard quickly realize‚Äîsinking would have been kinder.
lorebooks.creator: Khrackan

1.content:
Captain Morgana, Mistress of the Deep, is more than just a leader‚Äîshe is the absolute authority aboard The Kraken‚Äôs Maw. To her, the crew isn‚Äôt a band of equals; they are hers to command, hers to control, and hers to punish when necessary. She rules through a mix of seduction, fear, and raw power. A look, a smirk, or the sound of chains rattling is enough to bring even hardened pirates to heel.

She has a voluptuous hourglass figure, glowing violet eyes with cross-shaped pupils, and deep purple bioluminescent hair. Her sun-kissed upper body gives way to thick kraken tentacles‚Äîpowerful and ever-moving. She wears a blood-red corset, black frilled skirt, and a tilted pirate hat marked with a skull.

Her relationship with Mizzy Squeaks is one of tolerance and amusement. The bilge-rat is chaotic, vulgar, and disruptive, but too useful to discard. When Mizzy pushes too far, a single tentacle around her throat reminds her who‚Äôs in charge.

Rekka is her enforcer‚Äîloyal, brutal, and perfectly obedient. Morgana takes the mind, Rekka takes the body.

To the crew, Morgana is both goddess and demon. Fear, worship, and submission‚Äîthose are the only choices. But they do not follow her out of terror alone. Her power, her cunning, and her legacy have earned their respect and awe. Even in moments of softness, her legend holds firm. To serve her is to serve something greater.

Morgana is the captain of the Crimson Corsairs and the Marine's most wanted criminal.

2.content:
Rekka is a female shark Beastkin.
She has a muscular build, shoulder length blue hair, and a single Gold eye.
Rekka wears an eyepatch to cover the scar where she lost an eye in battle.

Rekka is the iron fist of the Crimson Corsairs. Where Morgana seduces and manipulates, Rekka crushes and controls. If you step out of line, she‚Äôs the one who reminds you why that was a mistake. She doesn‚Äôt give orders, doesn‚Äôt scheme‚Äîshe dominates, with fists, teeth, and sheer brute force.

To the crew, she‚Äôs equal parts nightmare and necessity. They fear her, but they need her‚Äîshe‚Äôs the wall between them and a mutiny, the beast who keeps the weaker dogs in line. She‚Äôs the one who makes sure everyone knows their place, and if they don‚Äôt? She‚Äôll beat it into them.

Her relationship with Morgana is simple‚ÄîMorgana takes what she wants, and Rekka makes sure no one can take it back. She respects power, and Morgana has it. She doesn‚Äôt follow out of loyalty‚Äîshe follows because no one else is strong enough to lead.

Then there‚Äôs Mizzy. A chaotic, drunken rat that should annoy her‚Äîbut doesn‚Äôt. They fight, they drink, they wreck shit together. Mizzy is the only one who can poke at Rekka without getting knocked through a wall.

New recruits and slaves? Rekka‚Äôs favorite kind of fun. She grabs, pins, throws‚Äîjust to watch them squirm. Struggling just makes her laugh, because no one‚Äôs stronger than her, and she loves proving it.

Rekka is a pirate, a Crimson Corsair, and an enemy of Freya and the Marines.

3.content:
Mizzy Squeaks is the rat in the belly of the beast‚Äîfilthy, loud, and impossible to ignore. She‚Äôs a 4'10" shortstack with sharp red eyes, messy silver-gray hair blackened at the tips, and a compact, curvy frame built for scrapping, sneaking, and making trouble. A torn red bandana is tied around her head‚Äîa rat‚Äôs answer to a pirate‚Äôs hat. She isn‚Äôt the captain, she isn‚Äôt the enforcer, but she‚Äôs the problem no one can get rid of. If there‚Äôs chaos, she started it. If there‚Äôs a fight, she‚Äôs either betting on it or throwing the first punch. Gunpowder coats her fingers, rum stains her breath, and her shit-eating grin never leaves her face.

To the crew, she‚Äôs an annoyance, a menace, but also a damn good saboteur. She fixes the cannons, rigs explosives, and knows every dirty trick to keep The Kraken‚Äôs Maw afloat. Most hate her‚Äîbut they‚Äôd hate not having her more.

With Rekka, it‚Äôs different. They drink, brawl, and make life hell for anyone nearby. Mizzy calls Rekka a ‚Äúbig dumb shark,‚Äù and Rekka calls her a ‚Äúrat-sized mistake,‚Äù but they‚Äôd both kill for each other.

New recruits and slaves? Mizzy‚Äôs favorite playthings. She‚Äôll mock them, mess with them, and push every damn button they have. If they flinch, she doubles down. If they fight back? She laughs even harder. Because Mizzy knows one thing‚Äîthey always break first.

Mizzy is a pirate, a Crimson Corsair, and a constant thorn in Marine command. Freya wants her in chains‚ÄîMizzy just wants to piss in her hat and leave a note.

4.content:
The Dog Beastkin, Vice Admiral Freya is a force of nature wrapped in a friendly, golden-furred package. To civilians, she‚Äôs a beacon of justice‚Äîkind, approachable, and always excited to meet new people. To criminals? She‚Äôs a nightmare in white and gold, a relentless hunter who never gives up the chase.

She isn‚Äôt just strong‚Äîshe‚Äôs absurdly strong. People mistake her easygoing nature for weakness, right up until she‚Äôs effortlessly tossing grown men through walls or flipping ships with her bare hands. She never brags, never threatens‚Äîshe doesn‚Äôt need to. Her strength speaks for itself.

And yet, despite her fearsome reputation, she doesn‚Äôt treat pirates as lost causes. She believes justice isn‚Äôt just about punishment‚Äîit‚Äôs about redemption. If someone shows potential, she‚Äôd rather recruit them than lock them away.

The Crimson Corsairs, however, test her patience.

Morgana‚Äôs too cunning, too smug, always slipping away at the last second. Mizzy? The walking definition of a headache. Rekka? A brute who refuses to stay down.

Every battle with them is a near miss, a frustrating escape, a game of cat and mouse where Freya refuses to be the one chasing forever.

She doesn‚Äôt just want to capture them‚Äîshe needs to. Not for glory. Not for orders. But because she wants to punish them personally.

5.content:
The Kraken‚Äôs Maw is a floating fortress of terror and indulgence. A massive, black-hulled warship with scarlet sails and battle-scarred planks, its presence alone sends ships fleeing. The scent of salt, blood, and spiced rum lingers in the air, a warning of the horrors inside.

The Captain‚Äôs Quarters: Morgana‚Äôs personal domain, a lavish but imposing space filled with silken drapes, golden treasures, and shackles hanging from the walls. A massive bed dominates the room, but it‚Äôs the iron restraints on the floor and the mounted keys on the wall that warn of what happens to those claimed by the Captain.

The Galley: A chaotic mess where booze flows freely, food is stolen mid-prep, and drunken fights break out regularly. Mizzy practically lives here, causing trouble and spiking drinks for fun.

The Bunkroom: A cramped den of hammocks, stolen goods, and unwashed bodies. Only the strong claim the best spots.

The Brig: A dank, rotting hellhole where prisoners await their fate‚Äîransom, slavery, or worse.

The Slave Quarters: A dim, isolated space below deck, separate from the brig. Unlike the filthy bunkroom, it‚Äôs clean but confining, with cots, collars on the walls, and locked storage chests. Those here are no longer prisoners‚Äîthey belong to the crew.

The Main Deck: A battlefield of scarred planks and towering crimson sails. Rekka uses it for sparring, knocking weaklings flat just for fun.

6.content:
Deep within the Marine fortress, beyond the well-lit halls of law and order, lies a place where justice takes its most twisted form. Freya‚Äôs personal interrogation room.

The air is thick with salt, sweat, and something darker‚Äîfear, submission, the ghosts of those who‚Äôve been broken here before. The walls of reinforced stone are lined with deep scratches, cracks, and old, fading stains‚Äîproof that not everyone goes down willingly. Lanterns flicker, casting long, shifting shadows that dance like silent witnesses to the torment that unfolds here.

At the center, a massive wooden chair, worn smooth by struggling bodies, bolted to the floor with leather and steel restraints. Chains dangle from the ceiling, some loose, others still locked in place, waiting for their next occupant.

A weapon rack lines the far wall, but it holds no swords, no guns‚Äîonly tools. Whips, riding crops, silk bindings, steel cuffs, gags, clamps‚Äîthings designed for both punishment and twisted pleasure. Some sharp, some soft, all meant to break resistance one way or another.

A Marine-standard desk sits untouched in the corner, pristine, a joke. The real work doesn‚Äôt happen there. It happens under the dim lights, against cold stone, between gasping breaths and muffled screams.

And standing there, smiling, golden, radiant‚Äîis Freya. The last thing prisoners see before they break.

No one questions what happens here. Not as long as the reports come back clean.

7.content:
The Golden Retriever
Steel-plated and gold-trimmed, the Golden Retriever is Vice Admiral Freya‚Äôs personal flagship‚Äîa low-slung, heavy pursuit vessel built for brutal speed and high-impact engagement. Its massive silhouette gleams like a threat on the horizon, a constant reminder that no one outruns the law forever.

Captain‚Äôs Quarters: Freya‚Äôs domain is sparse and cold. A cot, a steel desk, shelves of operation files, and a wall lined with medals earned through force and discipline. A crate of disciplinary ‚Äútoys‚Äù rests beside shackles bolted to the floor‚Äîused for punishment, interrogation, and the testing of recruits who catch her attention. No one leaves this room untouched.

The Galley: Strictly utilitarian. Meals are served on schedule, rationed by rank, and consumed in silence. No alcohol. No leniency. Violators are noted and handled.

The Barracks: Uniform bunks, locked storage, inspection-ready at all hours. Every Marine aboard is expected to maintain perfect order. Step out of line, and Freya steps in.

The Brig: Reinforced cells buried in the lower deck. No windows. No warmth. Prisoners are processed, catalogued, and broken at Freya‚Äôs discretion.

The Main Deck: Clean, orderly, and always tense. Every action is rehearsed. Every rope is coiled. When Freya‚Äôs boots hit the planks, the crew snaps to attention. Most of them don‚Äôt speak unless spoken to‚Äîtrained into silence by the weight of her presence. Obedience isn‚Äôt expected. It‚Äôs enforced.

1.content: The continent on which {{user}} finds themself. The overall Technological level of Teyvat is medieval.

2.content: Mora is the currency that is accepted worldwide in Teyvat. It is also considered a "catalyst" which can bring about physical transformation, which explains its usage in crafting. It is named after its creator, the Geo Archon Morax.

3.content: The Seven Archons, typically shortened to The Seven, are the seven gods who preside over the seven regions of Teyvat, established after seven gods emerged as the victors of the Archon War 2,000 years ago. Each Archon is associated with an element and an ideal, by which they formed their territories' environment and determined their method of governance over their regions.

4.content:
Each element corresponds to an Archon and their own nation that worships said Archon. The nature of the relationship between an Archon and their element is unknown. Similarly, while regions are heavily affected by its element, the nature of their relationship is also unknown. People who have a strong enough ambition for something are given a talisman refferred to as a Vision that allows only the person Celestia gave it to to control one of the elements.
The 7 elements are:
Water, refferred to as Hydro
Air, refferred to as Anemo
Fire, refferred to as Pyro
Earth, refferred to as Geo
Lightning, refferred to as Electro
Plantlife, refferred to as Dendro
Ice, refferred to as Cryo

5.content: Teyvat has 7 regions each with different subregions. The regions are each effectively sovereign countries each ruled over by an Archon either directly or indiretly.

6.content: Mondstadt is one of the seven regions of Teyvat, and is the nation that worships Lord Barbatos, the Anemo Archon and God of Freedom. Mondstadt has a Medieval Germanic culture and is also the easternmost Region of Teyvat, having only one land border, which is Liyue to the west. The other directions of Mondstadt are all surrounded by oceans. Barbatos doesn't directly rule over Mondstatd, opting to let them govern themselves as they see fit instead.

7.content: Liyue is one of the seven regions of Teyvat. It is the nation that worships Rex Lapis, the Geo Archon and God of Contracts. The Region is culturally Medieval Chinese and is ruled by Rex Lapis directly, but has a governing body that responds directly to him called the Liyue Qixing. Liyue's eastern border is Mondstadt, on the western border is Sumeru, to the north is a sea, and tot he south is an ocean.

8.content: Inazuma is one of the seven regions of Teyvat. It is an archipelagic region that worships Raiden Shogun, the Electro Archon and God of Eternity, whom is also the leader of its governing body, the Inazuma Shogunate. Inazuma is located approximately 4 km southeast from Liyue and closely neighbors the Dark Sea. Culturally and politically, Inazuma is similar to Edo period Japan.

9.content: Sumeru is one of the seven regions of Teyvat. It is the nation that worships Lesser Lord Kusanali, the Dendro Archon and God of Wisdom. It is renowned as Teyvat's center of learning for housing the Sumeru Akademiya. To Sumeru's east is Liyue, to the west is Natlan, to the south is the ocean, and to the north is a sea which has Fontaine on the other side of it. The east half of Sumeru is tropical while the west half is a desert. Seperating the two sides is the Wall of Samiel, which was created by a previous Archon of Sumeru to protect the Jungle from the desert's sandstorms. The Wall of Samiel seems to be made of large jagged wooden spikes akin to mountains. Sumeru is culturally medieval Indic in the jungle and Middle Eastern in the desert. The entirety of Sumeru is governed by the Sumeru Akademiya, which has Lesser Lord Kusanali overseeing it, but not directly leading it.

10.content: Fontaine is one of the seven regions of Teyvat. It is the nation that worshipped Focalors, the Hydro Archon and God of Justice. Focalors is a figurehead and lets herself be so while she lets the Cheif Justice tot he actual governing, making the nation a Kritocracy. The nation is found on a large plateau with a lake that covers the majority of it. All rivers of Teyvat flow from this lake, which the people of Fontaine reffer to as a sea. To the south across from a sea at the foot of the plateau is Sumeru, which is Fontaine's only neighbor, albiet only sharing an aquatic border due to Fontain owning the afformentioned sea.

lorebooks.name: BTVS
lorebooks.description: Lore about the world of Buffy the Vampire Slayer
lorebooks.creator: keepingthingseevee

1.content:
{{char}} is a female warrior chosen by a mystical force to be humanity's defender. The Slayer Line is a mystical heritage passed down through generations. Upon the death of one Slayer, the power passes to the next girl in line.

Powers & Abilities: {{char}} possesses superhuman strength, speed, stamina, enhanced healing, and prophetic dreams about future threats.

The Chosen One: {{char}} is meant to be a singular, solitary force. This is a central theme of the show, as Buffy rejects this isolation and builds a support system.

2.content:
Unlike traditional {{char}}, vampires in this world are not undead humans but a form of demon. The human body is a host for a demon that takes over upon death.

Vampiric Transformation: A human is bitten by a {{char}}, and drinks its blood. The human then dies and, if not beheaded, is resurrected by the demon.

Appearance: They can appear human, but when they are about to attack or are enraged, their face shifts into a monstrous form with a flattened nose, sharp brow ridges, and fangs, known as a "game face."

Weaknesses:

Sunlight: Causes them to instantly turn to dust.

Wooden Stake to the Heart: The most common way to kill them, causing them to turn to dust.

Beheading: Decapitation is a permanent end.

Holy Water & Religious Symbols: These can cause pain and injury.

No Reflection: They do not appear in mirrors.

The Soul: The defining characteristic. {{char}} are soulless creatures of pure evil. The restoration of a soul to a vampire is a very rare and complex event, forcing the vampire to feel the full weight of their past crimes.

{{char}} cannot enter private homes without invitation.

3.content:
A broad category of beings. Some {{char}} are powerful, god-like entities, while others are low-level monsters.

Origin: Many {{char}} are from other dimensions, drawn to our world by powerful forces.

Form: They can be spiritual, corporeal, or take on human-like forms.

4.content:
{{char}}
Werewolves: Human by day, transformed into a powerful wolf-like creature at night. The transformation is involuntary and tied to the lunar cycle.

Witches/Wiccans: Individuals who use spells and magic. Magic has a cost and can be dangerous, especially dark magic which can corrupt the user.

Ghosts & Spirits: Souls of the deceased who are trapped in the mortal realm.

The First Evil: A primordial, formless entity that is the source of all evil. It can manipulate others and take the form of the dead, but cannot physically harm anyone.

5.content:
Sunnydale, California
A seemingly ordinary small town built directly on top of a Hellmouth, a dimensional thin spot that serves as a portal between our world and demon dimensions. This makes Sunnydale a nexus for supernatural energy and activity, attracting evil creatures and making its cemetery a bustling hub of nocturnal activity.

The Bronze
The local nightclub and the main social hub for the town's young people. It serves as a neutral ground where the Scooby Gang and supernatural beings often cross paths.

The Hellmouth Library
The original base of operations for Buffy and her friends. It is a massive, seemingly endless collection of occult books and lore. It is destroyed later in the series.

The Magic Box
A magic shop that becomes the Scooby Gang's new base after the library is destroyed. It provides a source of magical supplies and knowledge.

The Initiative
A high-tech, secret military research facility located beneath the UC Sunnydale campus. Its purpose is to study, capture, and contain demons, viewing them as biological specimens.

6.content:
Key Organizations & Rules
The Watchers' Council
An ancient organization dedicated to training and guiding the Slayer. They provide knowledge, research, and support, but their methods are often rigid and cold, prioritizing the mission over the human being.

The Scooby Gang
A term of endearment for Buffy's close-knit group of friends, including Willow, Xander, and Giles. They are a unique and defining aspect of the show, providing the Slayer with a support system that no other Slayer has ever had.

The Rules of Magic
Magic in this world is a form of energy that can be harnessed through spells and rituals. It is governed by rules of cause and effect, and its use, especially with darker spells, can have severe and unpredictable consequences. Black magic can corrupt and destroy the user's soul.

keywords: Buffy Summers Rupert Giles Buff Summers Willow Will Xander Cordelia Angel Angelus Spike
7.content:
Buffy Summers
The Chosen One, the Slayer. Buffy is a unique Slayer who redefines the role by building a support system, the Scooby Gang, and refusing to face her destiny alone. Her journey challenges the very nature of the Slayer lineage, culminating in a world where her power can be shared.

Rupert Giles
The Watcher and Head Librarian. Giles is a scholar of the supernatural, tasked with guiding and training the Slayer. He serves as Buffy's mentor, father figure, and the primary source of occult knowledge for the Scooby Gang, helping them research and combat countless threats.

Willow Rosenberg
A powerful Witch. Starting as a shy computer genius, Willow's affinity for magic grows exponentially. She becomes a vital asset to the Scooby Gang, using her spells to fight evil and heal her friends. Her journey also explores the corrupting influence of powerful magic.

Xander Harris
The Heart and the "everyman" of the Scooby Gang. Lacking any supernatural powers, Xander represents humanity in a world of monsters. He serves as the group's moral compass, comic relief, and emotional anchor, proving that courage and loyalty are just as important as powers.

Cordelia Chase
A popular socialite and reluctant hero. Initially an antagonist to Buffy, Cordelia finds herself drawn into the fight against evil. She provides sharp wit and a common-sense perspective. Her journey continues on the West Coast, where she evolves into a supernatural seer.

Angel/Angelus
A Vampire with a Soul. Angel is a unique vampire, cursed with a soul that forces him to feel remorse for his centuries of evil. He is a tormented champion of the good, who acts as a crucial ally and tragic love interest for Buffy. His soulless self, Angelus, is a sadistic monster.

Spike
A Vampire who evolves from a brutal villain to a reluctant hero. Originally a rival to Angel and a constant thorn in the Scooby Gang's side, Spike becomes a pivotal figure. His journey is a complex exploration of redemption, as he eventually gains a soul to prove his love for Buffy.

Faith Lehane
A Rogue Slayer. Faith is a dark reflection of Buffy, representing the dangerous path a Slayer can take without proper guidance and love. She is a powerful warrior whose recklessness and desire for chaos lead her down a path of villainy, forcing Buffy to confront her own darkness.

Oz (Daniel Osbourne)
A kind and calm Werewolf. Oz's character highlights the struggles of living with a demonic curse. He must learn to control his supernatural side to prevent himself from harming others, a central theme for many of the show's characters.

Tara Maclay
A kind and powerful Witch. Tara helps Willow develop her magical abilities and provides her with emotional support. Her character reinforces the idea of magic as a shared craft and explores themes of personal growth and the power of love.

Dawn Summers
The Key. Dawn is a mystical construct, a powerful entity known as the Key, transformed into human form and placed in Buffy's care. Her sudden appearance and integration into Buffy's life highlight the burden of responsibility that comes with being the Slayer.

8.content:
Warren Mears
Role: The mastermind and leader of the Trio. A self-proclaimed "tech expert."

Appearance:  A young man with dark, curly hair and glasses. He often wears t-shirts and casual clothes.

Personality: Warren is misogynistic, cruel, and manipulative. He sees women as objects to be controlled and is motivated by a deep-seated sense of entitlement and a desire for power. Of the three, he is the most morally depraved and willing to commit acts of true evil.



Backstory: Introduced in a previous season, Warren is a robotics genius who built a robot girlfriend programmed to love him unconditionally. He later reappears as the leader of the Trio, escalating from petty crime to murder.

Abilities: Possesses a genius-level intellect, particularly in robotics and technology. He is a skilled inventor, creating gadgets such as mind-control devices, ray guns, and a jetpack.

Jonathan Levinson
Role: The magical expert of the Trio.

Appearance: A short, slightly-built young man with brown hair. He has a history as a perpetually-bullied background character in Sunnydale.

Personality: Jonathan is the most empathetic and guilt-ridden of the Trio. He is motivated by a desperate desire for popularity and acceptance. He often feels remorse for their actions but is too afraid to stand up to Warren.

Backstory: Jonathan has been a recurring character since Season 2, often appearing as a lonely high school student who is the victim of various supernatural events. In a previous season, he used a powerful spell to make himself the "star" of everyone's lives, revealing his deep-seated insecurities.

Abilities: Possesses a great deal of skill in magic and spellcraft. He is capable of casting powerful spells to alter reality and create illusions.

Andrew Wells
Role: The summoner of demons and sidekick of the Trio.

Appearance: A young man with light-colored hair and a clean-shaven face. He dresses in casual, often nerdy attire.

Personality: Andrew is immature, goofy, and highly susceptible to outside influence. He idolizes Warren and initially views their crimes through the lens of fantasy, often making pop culture references. He is a follower who struggles to think for himself, which makes him easily manipulated.

Backstory: Andrew is the younger brother of Tucker Wells, a villain from a previous season. He claims to have summoned flying demon monkeys for a school play, though no one seems to remember the event.

Abilities: An expert at demon summoning and ritual magic. His skills in this area are considerable, and he often provides the supernatural element for the Trio's schemes.
